The room we had was large and very well appointed, looking new and impeccably clean. The bathroom was also large, with a bath and separate shower, all done in tasteful marble. The bed was particularly excellent; just the right level of firmness with loads of squidgy pillows. We slept very well. We had room-service breakfast a couple of mornings and it was about as good as it gets for a US breakfast i.e. the best. It arrived dead on time, brought by a courteous person. There was more than we could eat and it was delicious. We did pop into the bar once for a drink and it was comfortable if rather corporate. Not somewhere anyone would go unless they were staying at the hotel though. There was a restaurant area but it looked little-used and was not even mentioned in the room’s hotel guide, so I can’t say much about it. The staff were universally friendly and helpful. Always ready with a smile and friendly word. Check-in was quick and efficient. Of course, there were a few niggles. Things that might or might not bother you but as private (rather than corporate) travellers they did take the edge off the stay for us: First off, there were the seemingly unnecessary extra charges. Let’s face it, this place is expensive; you are paying a location premium and it’s a good hotel, so why charge $13 a day for internet access or $55 a day for parking? Both of these can be had for half the price locally so the hotel really doesn’t need to rip off their guests for these services. If your company is paying then this might not bother you but for us it just meant we had to spend a little time finding cheaper wireless internet and parking, time that the hotel could have saved us by not being so mean. That price premium is reflected elsewhere in the hotel - $5 for a couple of strips of bacon, $13 for a glass of chardonnay, $18 for a movie. At a room rate of $269 a night, they really shouldn’t be hiking up the prices like this. Only other niggle, and it’s not so big, is the lobby/reception area. There isn’t one really or at least not on the street front. When you arrive it looks like the entrance to an underground parking lot, with a few chairs for smokers; when we arrived I first thought we were at a service entrance. Once inside it’s just a smallish elevator waiting area up to III, where the lobby proper is. Then it’s very nice. One more small thing: The room was a double, yet had only one chair to sit on to eat our room-service meals. This meant one of us had to perch on the edge of the high bed to eat. This might be a reflection of the hotel’s more usual single business traveller clientele. So, in summary, it was a lovely stay, the room and service were excellent. If you aren’t on any kind of budget and don’t mind the slightly impersonal feel of the building and bar then you should have a good stay too. Oh, almost forgot to say...Make sure you get dropped off at the right hotel! There are at least three Marriotts close by and its all too easy for a taxi driver to take you to the wrong one when you first arrive - as happened to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MSportsAuto
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff. Stayed to be near Union Square. Found it to be great location, to walk to trolley or catch the sightseeing bus. Our room was great very uptodate. Would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: Munichchick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott Union Square for 9 nights for Semicon and Intersolar shows at the Moscone Center. My company had Exhibits at both and I booked a room block for everyone. This was our second year staying at the JW and it is a very good business hotel close to Union Square. It's about 6 blocks from the Moscone and a bit of a walk especially after standing in a booth all day or when you have to go back and forth. The rooms are very comfortable modern and have everything a business traveler or tourist would need. I had a corner room on the 20th floor and it was a great location with view of the golden gate bridge on days without fog (3 out of 9 days). The king bed is comfortable and lots of good pillows. Bathroom is nice with granit and marble but very small shower. I am not a large person and it felt cramped. A tall or large person would not feel comfortable in that shower. The water power was really bad and it took a long time to get the shampoo out of my hair every day which was a big negative for me. Otherwise everything was positive with room and service. Nice bathrobe, little slippers, good bath products, lots of towels. Turndown service every evening, newspapers in the morning at the door step. Very good concierge, great Bell Man Team. Super helpful an friendly. Even remembered me from last year and helped making restaurant reservations at Kuletos last minute. Helped us getting the Marriott towncar to Little Italy etc. The bar in the lobby is very nice and they make good cocktails. This year they had Happy Hour which was very appreciated by all of us. Good areas behind the bar & lobby area for business meetings even had flatscreens that can be used for powerpoint presentations. The breakfast area is nice but expensive at $29. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you want to stay near Union Square or need to attend tradeshows at the Moscone Center.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with great service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: daspurz
Reviews.Content: Nice, trendy hotel in a great location in SF. Service was great and the room was wonderful too. Any additional requests, room service, etc was taken care of in a prompt manner. The room was very comfortable, spacious and came with a great view of San Francisco. The showers are nice too. I would recommend staying here multiple times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: biniland
Reviews.Content: Excellent location but the front desk staff were not great. Probably service in America was generally lacking. My room was big and I loved all those pillows and cusions on the bed. It was extremely comfortable. Great bathroom also. I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: objective12
Reviews.Content: A few steps away from Union square. The concierge and bell-boys were friendly and extremely helpful. We were in a lovely spacious studio on a high floor. My advice would be to either memorise where the lights are when you go to bed at night or keep a flashlight handy:) First night I was there, couldn't find the light switch in the bathroom at 3 am! So frustrating when you are not alone in the room and can't put on the room lights. Surprised they hadn't thought of those switches that glow in the dark. If I had very young children, I would be nervous staying on a high floor. The balcony rails did not look to me to be child-safe. They probably are, if they were allowed but, I have seen young children stick their heads into smaller spaces than the ones they had at the JWM. Worth checking out if you plan on visiting with 2 year olds. Otherwise, a nice place to stay in SF. The room was always cleaned early and was spotless. For smokers, they have a nice set up outdoors in the front of the hotel, with sofas, cushions, and ashtrays. Very civilised:)

Reviews.Title: “My Heart is in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: jahjay62
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend in San Francisco and spent one night at the JW Marriott Union Square. We really enjoyed the hotel. Everything was clean and fairly up to date. The hotel staff was very nice and we enjoyed the location. The hotel was convenient to Union Square and lots of shopping and great restaurants. We enjoyed some drinks and snacks at the bar. The room was comfortable and very clean. The bathroom was also nice and roomy. The concierge lounge was open for breakfast on Sunday morning which was very convenient. I am a frequent Marriott customer and continue to be impressed with most properties. Despite a few negative reviews, I believe that I am a reasonable judge of hotels and this one was great and I was quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Well taken care of”
Reviews.Author: pickietravlr
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel after a bad experience at another. The front desk was very friendly, helpful and offered first cass service. The hotel coffee bar was handy and the restaurant was very good. Overall a very relaxing and pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: J_A_Mc98
Reviews.Content: We were switching hotels so we showed up around noon hoping for an early check in which we received with no problem. The valet staff was very courteous and helpful unloading our car and bringing our bags up. Unfortunately we arrived on Friday afternoon and weren't able to enjoy the concierge lounge which is closed on the weekend. The cable car stop was a few blocks away and received great directions and tips on how to get around the city. I would definitely stay again if returning to SF!

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: TheCommanderLeyland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night and found it an ideal location for exploring Union Square and local shops. Not cheap, but good value. Car Parking Vala Service $50 per 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GLAL17
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located right in the heart of great shopping and great restaurants!! Rooms are very nice with very comfortable beds. Staff is very pleasant, professional and helpful. Would stay here again. The only negative I can say is the lack of wi-fi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ne_quine
Reviews.Content: We selected this Marriott hotel after someone recommended it to us on the TA forums and what a great recommendation it was! Our first impression upon entering the hotel was ‘wow’ and we seemed to repeat it quite often during out week’s stay. Check-in was a breeze and the ladies on the front desk were very friendly and efficient. There was a slight problem with the room type allocated but the ladies changed it without hesitation to the one we were after. Indeed, I was really impressed with one of the ladies who actually remembered my name when we stopped by to check something out later on in the week – that has never happened to me before! The lifts in the hotel are very different from any others in that you can watch the floors rise/fall as you go up/down because they are glass lifts. It did take a bit of getting used to! Our room was on the 11th floor overlooking Mason Street. The room was massive! A large bed with a sitting area to the side, a large desk with a comfy chair and the large flat screen TV. And a big plus from other Marriott hotels we’ve stayed at – firm pillows!!! The air con worked very well and you barely heard it working. The bathroom was massive too with a separate shower although it would have been better if the shower head hadn’t been fixed to the wall. I liked the toiletries that were in the bathroom, the moisturiser especially since I didn’t take any with me – and no, you didn’t have to pay for them! As for those who have mentioned noise – yes you heard the odd fire engine pass but it wasn’t loud enough to really cause any major hassles. I can’t say we heard any other noises from either the street or the atrium given the way the hotel is laid out. The concierge lounge was a great place to go for breakfast or somewhere to go in the evening either pre/post evening meal. The ladies were very friendly and helpful especially the one on in the morning. And the view from the lounge earned another ‘wow’ from us too! We ate at the bar a couple of nights - that mac & cheese was absolutely delicious! The bar staff were very friendly to you as were the restaurant staff the night we ate there, so much so they used to come up and chat to us when we were sitting in the bar having a drink. I wouldn’t say that either the bar or the restaurant was over-priced. The location of the hotel was great – just minutes away from Union Square and the main shopping zone of the city. We took the recommendation of the concierge for a meal in Chinatown and wasn’t disappointed. The bell-boys were super efficient in getting taxi’s when they were needed and were always ready with a warm smile when you returned back to the hotel. I’d more than recommend this hotel to anyone – it’s the first time we’d stayed at a JW but it probably won’t be the last if the standards of the JW San Francisco is anything to go by!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SLC-MLBF
Reviews.Content: We check in to the JW Marriott for a 3 night stay with our two teenagers. I had reqeusted a high floor and was put on the 6th floor. The woman that checked us in was pretty cold. The hotel is nice and clean. Great location for seeing the sight in San Francisco. The beds were soft and was great for a good nights sleep. However, with being on the 6th floor, we heard all of the street noices for most of the night. That does not happen in most Marriott hotels. As this was not build as a Marriott in the first place, that may be a factor for the noice as it is an older hotel. The concierge was great and gave us some great tips for seeing the city. Note that parking is 48.00 per night plus tax. That is the going rate for parking this area of San Francisco. At check out the front desk agent informed us that we could have parked our car across the street for a bit less. He was very helpful and wished he would have been on duty when we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we had expected”
Reviews.Author: s_seret
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott during a stopover and to be by near the Union Square area for a day of shopping. When we reserved the room, we chose the most expensive available online and thought it seemed like a good value. They made a big deal about their designer lobby and lounge and we thought it was worth a try. Our overall experience was quite a let down. The room itself felt like a lifeless box. There was something about plug sockets built into the headboard that was disturbing. The colors were bland and it was basically a bed, desk and TV. In fact, the room seemed to be built around this big flat screen TV, as if that was the only important detail to them. It was a standard room and probably meant for the business traveler. I did not sleep well, probably because my pillows were very lumpy. The hairdryer was awful and started to burn my fiancee's hair. We paid to store the car for a day, which was $50. Since we were only staying for one night, we asked the front desk if it would be alright to leave the car while we shopped. She said we had already paid for a full day's rate and would be fine. When we went to pick up the car, they asked for an additional $15, since we arrived at 5:30pm, even though we arrived around 7pm the night before. After 5pm it turned to an hourly rate, which was not explained to us. There was little point arguing and simply something to be expected at a hotel such as this. Overall it was not what we were expecting.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: ismaryandedgar
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and beautiful hotel. The service was great. The views were awesome. The hotel has a modern decor. Comfortable beds and flat screen TV. It is across the street from an amazing breakfast place and great sushi. The parking is pricey but the hotel is close enough to everything to not really need a car.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel around union sq”
Reviews.Author: Diamantaire
Reviews.Content: THE STAFF: I have an elite status with the hotel & had booked the room directly with them. I had requested 2 double beds & a roll away. When we arrived at the hotel they gave us the smallest room with a king size bed & no roll away . Was to tired after a 16 hour flight to change rooms & get into arguements. The concierge of the hotel was trying to coax us to take a limo 55$ /hr for sight seeing & even told us there are not sight seeing buses/ tours that he knows of, the same thing was repeated the the lobby staff. The staff in the lobby is very rude & cold . Since I am an elite member was allowed complimentary water & soda from the gift shop located on the lobby level . The lobby staff behaved in a very unprofessional manner whenever we wanted complementary beverages. LOCATION: The best thing about the hotel is the location, is a block away from union sq. ROOMS: The rooms are old & need to be redone . The windows are very old air & noise seep through them. Basic amenities like room slippers were not present in the room. MISC: The lounge on the top floor is closed on fridays & saturdays. The Westin which a stones throw from this property is a way better deal for a similar price. I think the marriot group has a lot to learn from the sheraton group of hotels regarding hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location and first class service”
Reviews.Author: worldadventurers
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott delivered what one expects forma 5 star SF hotel. The room, guest services, check-in, was all first class. The location is prime for theater, restaurants and public transportation. We'll come back for our next stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Expensive, but nice ....”
Reviews.Author: FredSmeggins
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in May as a solo traveller. It was a week of contemplation and decision making for me so I wasn't overly concerned with the strengths and weaknesses of the hotel. I was lucky to have sufficient Marriott points to cover most of my stay, but paid usual hotel rates for the last 3 nights. Check-in was smooth and swift, and my room was spacious with a nice bathroom. I didn't eat at the hotel, nor did I use the leisure / fitness facilities so can't comment on those - too busy out exploring this wonderful city :0) It has a very good location on the corner of Post / Mason within easy walking distance of all transport links and up-market shopping and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice wedding anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights with my wife to celebrate our 3rd wedding anniversary. I had called ahead of time to mention the occasion and request both an upgraded room and chocolate covered strawberries and champagne in the room. Upon arrival, my Gold Elite status was acknowledged and I was informed that they had upgraded me to an executive suite and because of my status the champagne and strawberries would be complimentary. So this was already off to a nice start. Let me say, I travel a lot and am not often impressed by a hotel room, but this room was the most impressive I have stepped foot in. I would estimate that it was close to 800 square feet with separate sleeping, sitting, powder and bathroom area's. There was even a "butler switch" on the wall - I sadly did not have the opportunity to use it. I was disappointed that the club lounge was closed all weekend, but they did offer me (and other premium elite guests) any drinks out of the little snack area free of charge. My biggest problem though are the PAPER THIN walls. I completely agree with other reviewers that they do not keep much of anything at all from going room-to-room. My wife and I were treated to the sounds of extracurricular activity coming from the neighboring room on multiple occasions (maybe they were celebrating an anniversary also), but regardless, sounds should not be that clear. I saw that a lot of reviewers compared this to hotels abroad, I just don't think it is a fair comparison because many travel related experiences, from flights to luxury hotels, are just nicer abroad. But I don't think that makes this JW any less of a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average JW”
Reviews.Author: bluejax21
Reviews.Content: Where to start with this place? I stayed at this location from 23 to 25 April 2011. I arrived on a Saturday morning in hopes of getting an early check in prior to heading off to a Giants game with a friend. I had requested two beds in the room and confirmed this with the agent at the counter when I tried to check in. She told me these rooms were in high demand and none were yet available for check-in. No real problems there. I am not quite bold enough to expect a guaranteed early check-in. However, as I am a Platinum member, I asked if I could wait in the Club Lounge until either my room was ready or I went to the game. I was a little shocked to hear the lounge was closed on the weekends. I think this is a first for me - every other Renaissance or JW I go to overseas (and often domestic) has this facility open on the weekend for the enjoyment of guests. I resigned myself to waiting in the admittedly expansive lounge area near the Front Desk. On the Sunday night of our visit, my friend and I visited the Club Lounge for some snacks and drinks. This Lounge features an Honor Bar, even for Platinum guests (at least if that is not the case, I was not informed). For those not familiar, this is a bar on a counter with little sheets of paper. They expect you to mark your drinks as you go and then give it to the attendee so they can charge your room. I refuse to pay for drinks at a Club Lounge, as they are often free at every overseas location (and again, some domestic). I did not see anyone else in the lounge drinking. There were maybe six other people. Once I went over to examine the Honor Bar set up, and I thought I felt the collective eyes of the lounge visitors on me to see if I would be the first to grab a drink and not fill out a sheet. I did not. The attendee did not say one word of greeting to me or my friend upon arrival at the lounge. Needless to say, we did not feel overly welcomed, and left shortly after arriving. It was a disappointing experience. People staying at this property should be advised there are a multitude of vagrants in vicinity of the property, especially at night. You will be harassed once you cross the street in any direction, guaranteed. Consider yourself warned. I secured a late checkout of 3PM on the Monday I was due to leave. Despite this assurance from the front desk, there were three different visitors to the room knocking. Between the cleaning crew and the guy trying to check the mini bar, I felt they were trying to get us out of the room. Also, my Guest Folio provided for the agreed upon charge, but the hotel overcharged me (as seen upon my credit card bill), and I am currently having to take my time to discover what the additional charges were so I can dispute them. Very unsettling and irritating. Overall, not a pleasant stay, and I would likely not return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Only Good Location...the rest look somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: malbahari
Reviews.Content: Outdated Rooms, NO CHILDREN TV CHANNELS!!! Only ONE...Unacceptable when traveling with kids!!! VERY SENSITIVE MAGNETIC ROOM KEYS...this is how the Front Office Clerck justify the inappropriate key types...used for the rooms...and every time we came back from the street, needed to go down to have new keys to open the rooms!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice”
Reviews.Author: Prolix50
Reviews.Content: I'd say this is a good Marriott property not too far off of what they usually offer. Check-in was speedy. The room was nice sized for SF, and the bathroom too with a separate shower, but a bit cramped with a low shower head if you're over 6'3". Housekeeping was very good, cleaned my room at 9 when requested and gave more towels later on. I had access to the conceirege lounge which had a good breakfast and happy hour foods/drinks - open all day weekdays. Used the exercise room which was fine. I was on the 18th floor, but could still hear some street noise - garbage trucks, etc., but I'm a light sleeper. No complaints really.

Reviews.Title: “Marquis not JW Quality”
Reviews.Author: BC_Eagle_JD
Reviews.Content: Location is fine. It is safe area and access to shopping and theatres is easy. However, I really think that this hotel should be designated a "Marquis" rather than a "JW" by the Marriott corporation. Why you may ask? Well, I am quite prejudiced having enjoyed countless nights at the JW in Hong Kong where the attentive service in unmatched. If you have the opportunity to treat yourself to this extraordinary experience. Well back to the JW in SF. When I booked it for my family and me, I just presumed that it had all the amenities of a JW. It was disappointing and the amount of money paid per night (269) was not worth it. Why? 1. JWs, even the new one recently built in Chitown, has a pool (or at least plans to open it up). With young kids in tow, I was anticipating have them enjoy the pool and fitness area. There was no pool and the fitness area did not have steam or sauna area - very much like the Marquis in NYC. 2. Again, I don't like to belabor this, but other members have also raised this concern about Marriott. I put out thousands of dollars to stay at Marriotts exclusively over one hundred nights a year. Legitimately, I should have written "the business," but I am "the business!" I have a simple expectation: to be treated like royalty. Now there are some Marriotts that do this. A small one in the shopping section of Poughkeepsie had my name on a welcome board. At first thought, I was embarrassed, but then thought they did it right. Why can't the front desk personnel here at this location thank me for my patronage and also offer me a premium room. I am tired of having to barter and bargain to get an upgrade. 3. Being a premium member, I have access to the concierge lounge, but this space was unappealling. Everyday my family had to negotiate whether to take the watery powdered eggs or not. Recommendation: make those little signs and place them in front of the food products so people know what they might be eating instead of having to wait to find the employee to explain the two choices (at night). There must be a number of premium members utilizing this space, because space is a premium when trying to find a place and enjoy some food. I am not sure what exactly the employees do except fill the refrigerators with drinks. Food then tends to run out and guests have to wait ten minutes for the employee to get the food from downstairs. One cannot expect the lounge level personnel to do anything more than fill those refrigerators and set up/dismantle the buffets. I asked very simply for some help with theatre tickets and faxxing something only to be told that those services are carried out by the concierge desk on the third floor. Again, a Marquis, not a JW. A JW would have an employee on staff for faithful guests. 4. Housekeeping needs some adjustment on two fronts: toiletries and turn-down service. Our family was given this small face soap bar (1!) for the shower and one for the sink. We thought it might be a mistake, but when the second day arrived and one of them was replaced (not two), we realized that we needed to find a Walgreen's for a more human sized soap bar. On the issue of turn down service, why is it between 5 and 6? We'd be out all day and return to enjoy a nap. Then we realized we had to coordinate our time around the evening service. It should be later. I really think Marriott has to either upgrade this property, lower the costs, renovate, or change its designation to a Marquis or less.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, centrally located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kristin7
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The lobby is very dramatic and modern, and checking in was a breeze. Our room wasn't huge, but large enough with a very comfortable bed. The windows in this hotel are neat, with their half circle shape. The bathrooms are very large & impressive! They're all marble and have a large vanity with two sinks, plus a separate tub & shower. The hotel itself is very centrally located in terms of Union Square shopping and dining. I've stayed in hundreds of hotels & this was one of my favorites. Very elegant!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Malim27
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights. Upgraded to suite which was nice. Rooms clean and comfortable. However, walls between my room and the next were a little thin or have no sound-proofing, as I heard all the action from next door which was a designated easy access/wheelchair room. Makes you wonder, eh? A/C also didn't seem very powerful and took a while to get things cool/warm. Breakfast was good with nice choices. Reception is too small, meaning not enough desks - there were always lines. Best part is the location, a block or so away from Union Square shopping and restaurants. Also, if you are driving, access is via Mason, not Post.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Luxury Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: LCMac
Reviews.Content: As a Diamond Hilton VIP member, I was looking to start staying at some Marriotts and was pleasantly surprised by the JW Marriott in San Francisco. Without status, I was upgraded to a suite after showing my Hilton Diamond card. The room was very clean and modern. Service in the bar and at the hotel front desk were excellent. The only drawback I can think of is the noise audible from the street below at night. There tends to be lots of street noise in this area of town. However, it is not isolated to this hotel. Colleagues staying at the nearby Hilton complained of a great deal more noise. After this experience I will likely start staying at more Marriotts since I am a very frequent traveler. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, registration problems”
Reviews.Author: Roeina
Reviews.Content: I often frequent SF because I was born and raised in North Beach. This time I was playing tourist guide to a friend who is a single parent and was attending a conference and I offered to watch his 6 year old during the day. I had problems with both of my atm credit cards. I put the deposit money on one card because I know that hotels "hold" your debit transaction for 3 to 4 business days, although they tell you its your bank that does this.....This time guess what, I got charged on both cards!!! and I noticed it the next day I was there, it took me 25 minutes and I had to call my bank myself, ask to speak to a supervisor before this girl could reverse and delete the transaction....that very same weekend I had to stay in the city and guess what the exact same thing happened....If you do not have a credit card and use your debit card do not plan on using that money that they are holding as a "pending" charge on your acct. they will hold it for 3 to 4 business days!!! Other then that the hotel was good, I got a great friends/family employee rate The guy that registered us I could tell did not believe she was staying in the room with me....Hence, I think the duplicate charge....horrible business practice.....I did like the marble bathroom although very small and I did like the flat screen tv, the bed was horrible, first night I could not get comfortable at all, lumps everywhere....it must have been a very worn out mattress...they ought to check that out....other then that I would still recommend this hotel, just be preparred and if you don't like your room ask to be changed to another....

Reviews.Title: “Fine But Not Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: danielbeez
Reviews.Content: Room was fine, club lounge (including breakfast) was fine, service was fine, everything was fine--just nothing outstanding. Note that I am a Gold member, and the hotel wasn't very crowded, but I was given what seemed to me a very standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, typical Marriott amenities. Not the best management.”
Reviews.Author: avmiddleton
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this JW. Like many JWs, it was a step above regular Marriotts in Union Square. We enjoyed the location--- it was centrally located to shops, restaurants, and some attractions. As other reviewers have noted, there is no free internet--- even in the lobby (if you have stayed with Marriott before, you are likely used to this). The concierge level amenities were impeccable, with great breakfasts and snacks on weekdays. Seems like it would be ideal for business travelers or those willing to spend a bit more on leisure travel. As one caveat to my review: we had the unfortunate experience of having noisy (i.e., yelling, screaming, perhaps tipsy) neighbors for one night. The management seemed reluctant to take care of this, which was clearly less than ideal. We had to threaten to call the police ourselves to have them take care of the noise next door.

Reviews.Title: “Was going to give it 3* but it's worth 4”
Reviews.Author: jbmWyoming
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband during a 4 night stay while attending a concert. I was going to give it 3 stars but realized that when rating the location, rooms and sleep quality I had to give it 4. Location terrific. Our room was very large with a super bathroom. Nice closets in the hallway with plenty of space, comfortable beds and it was quiet. Looked to be recently updated. Cons -- concierge lounge had very limited hours for us and it had the worst quality of food we've had in a lounge in a long time. The front desk staff while kind of friendly (but not necessarily welcoming) all seemed to be "filling in" from other departments and I can't say it was a smooth check-in. We had several trips to the front desk for several reasons and no one seemed to know answers. The concierge was either never there or there was a very long line. She did give us excellent tips and directions for our weekend concerts. The lobby bar was fine and the bartender was nice and late night food was good. Not a lot of late night options for a place to grab a drink in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...”
Reviews.Author: iscreenwriter
Reviews.Content: Great location and hotel seems like it would be great with room rize and hotel set up. Not into the atrium thing with hallways open to lobby. Room was a bit noisy. Can hear people watching TV. If you aren't a light sleeper this hotel is ok but city has much better

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: asaksa50
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business trip so I tagged along and stayed here. The hotel is very nice and the rooms were very clean with wonderful views of the city. Concierge Lounge was very convenient and deserts/food and drinks plentiful. The front desk staff and bartenders in the lobby bar were friendly also. No complaints. 2 blocks from the heart of shopping. Great crepe brunch and thai places across the street. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY AND CONVENIENCE”
Reviews.Author: rxhappiness
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a quick getaway from home (2 hours flight) and I was totally impressed with their amenities and service. Walking distance to Chinatown and the high end shopping areas at Union Square. Also easily accessible to the cable cars to complete the San Francisco experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodDuo
Reviews.Content: Overall an excellent hotel. First class service, high quality rooms, but at a price. If you can afford it I can definitely recommend it. It is right near the shopping center of San Francisco but kind of far from all the typical touristy spots. The hotel bar and restaurant were both very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly roomy for San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLee1986
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott in San Francisco's Union Square is gorgeous. First off, the rooms are extremely roomy and very tastefully decorated. Our room even came complete with some artwork that even had its own museum lighting! This is a great pick for a romantic night in the city after a day of site seeing. The bed is huge and comfortable, there is a large closet, and the bathroom is one of the most luxurious I have ever seen. Although I can't imagine a better place to spend the night, this may not be the best place to bring a new girlfriend or boyfriend, because the bathroom doesn't have an actual door, just a sliding panel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Cindy2012
Reviews.Content: After staying at JW Marriott Hotels in the past We were very disappointed in the service. We arrived by car and had to struggle with our luggage trying to get through the doors since there was no doorman. We stayed for 2 nights and never were able to speak with the concierge. The breakfast was included with our upgraded room (which we paid for). The breakfast buffet was sparse and not up to JW Marriott standards. We were a little supprised that the rooms were smaller then typical Marriott rooms but they were clean and nicely appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay - but why are we still charging for Internet in 2010.”
Reviews.Author: kayleigh_k
Reviews.Content: Nice central hotel for any tourist staying in San Francisco. Close to the bars and restaurants of union square. An easy walk to the shopping on Market Street. Easy to get to Fisherman Wharf. Walkable from Powell Street station if your arriving by air and want a cheap ride into town (we managed to walk with 2 bags each no problem). Like all JW Marriott they charge for internet - which in my eyes is simply unacceptable in this day and age - especially since the "lesser" hotels (including Marriott, Marriott Courtyard, etc) all give it for free. You can get it free in Borders which is a few doors down - or in many other areas around the city (the tourist centre, various pubs, various diners, most coffee shops) - we infact went out to breakfast to a diner across the road for the sole purpose of the free internet - the fact that JW Marriott want to charge is no longer acceptable - the only thing which prevents me giving it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Divatraveler19
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location close to many attractions. Most all it was very clean. I consider myself a hotel snob, who only stays in 4-5 star hotels. The staff was able to recommend an excellent route to run, dinner recommendations, and tours. I would stay here again if I am in San Fran. Not sure the city view rate was worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mators
Reviews.Content: the place is clean and accessible to everything that i need

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Freshly remodeled. Modern, clean, quiet room.”
Reviews.Author: sfile472
Reviews.Content: I was greatly surprised. Originally I was skeptical about staying in a Marriott given all the other boutique hotels in the same area. We found our room to be a quiet sanctuary from busy, noisy, fun Union Square. Super comfy bed with wonderful built in features (reading lamps and side tables). Clean bathroom. The hotel was remodeled less than a year ago - very fresh decor throughout. Fantastic location, too. Only thing missing was free internet service. Very easy base throughout our 3-day stay. We will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “They try to be a 5 star but get only a 3.5 star from me”
Reviews.Author: Tobty
Reviews.Content: Just trying to find the lobby to check in is a hassle. Once we did, we found little things didn't work like the in room safe and the remote for the television. We went out to get lunch and stopped by the reception and informed them of the situation (hotels have problems, but how they fix it separated to fine hotels from the also rans). The concierge was not in(actuall never saw the concierge behind the concierge desk) and was told to go to the reception desk for help. They unfortunately did not have a clue as to what was around them for lunch or dinner and sent us in the wrong direction (thank god for Frommers). When we returned to the room around six hours the problems where not fixed and when we called the reception they sent someone up who forgot. We were on the ninth floor and could hear the street clearly which is not good at 2 in the morning when you are trying to sleep (I guess they don't know about double panes in the windows to keep the sound out). When I tried the in room coffee, the smell that came out was mildew. I just gave up and said that I was only here for 2 days. The only good part was the waiter (Micheal) who waited on us at the bar. As for the room, I think I'll try Best Western next time; at least I can get these problems and pay a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: adri1493
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at about 1:30pm and were offered a room right away with no hesitations. We were given a room on the 8th floor (#801 no view) but that's ok since I was happy I got checked in early. The room was clean, modern, with a nice size TV. The bathroom was big with plenty of counter space and the usual amenities. We ordered room service that evening - clam chowder, pizza, and couple of hot chocolates - and it was better than expected. It was expensive but that's usually the case with room service. The beds were very comfortable and the noise was minimal. Because of the open lobby surrounded by the rooms, you do hear some buzz but nothing too disturbing. I had good night sleeps both nights. The staff was extremely friendly, even though the hotel structure seems pretentious, the staff was definitely customer service oriented and made us feel welcomed. I accidentally had moved things around the mini fridge (before deciding to order room service) and was later listed on my bill. I was expecting to fully explain myself at check out to avoid the extra charges, but the gentleman who helped me apologized for the sensitive motion sensors on the fridge and removed the charges right away. The location of this hotel was also great and conveniently located one block away from Union Square. If you're driving in, like I did from L.A., there's a parking structure accross the street which charges about $28 per day (w/in and out priveleges). I parked my car and never used it until I was ready to go home but the parking structure is literally steps away from the hotel entrance so there's no need to have paid the $45 valet parking at the hotel. All I can say is great rooms, great service, great location, with great service!

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating and earplugs”
Reviews.Author: WalterNC
Reviews.Content: This was not what I expect from JW Marriott. I have stayed at them around the world, and this was by far the worst. 1. Needs updating: you can tell it is really old. The hallway rugs, the room rugs, the exterior (from the exterior, it looks like a holiday inn). 2. Noise: On each floor, there is an open middle that you can look down to the lobby/bar/restaurant. The first night I was there is was so loud from the bar noise, that after being up for 21 hours, I couldn't sleep. There was even bad singing. I was 7 floor up. 3. Disorganization: the 2nd night, a man had been assigned my room so unsuccessfully (thankfully) was trying to get into my room at about 12:30 am. Thank goodness for the deadbolt. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with great beds and showers”
Reviews.Author: Annie9999
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night in the city after a long weekend in the wine country. In my opinion, the hotel was perfect. The bed was extremely comfortable, the shower head was fantastic, and all the people were great. The concierge and bell hops were very helpful and nice. The hotel is close to lots of good restaurants and bars, as well as all the shops in Union Square. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, friendly and...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice rooms, friendly and accomodating staff. Had an enjoyable stay here with our teenaged kids.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and calm in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Bowiememe
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location. Top of the line soaps and lotions. Great bed and great pillows. Able to walk to cable cars, Muni lines and sites including Chinatown. Good base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “If only I could afford this”
Reviews.Author: hoz49
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights on our West Coast Tour, starting in Seattle and ending in LA. We usually overnight in bargain fleabag motels (we're retired and living on a fixed income) but this was comped by my stepson, he travels for business and has boocoo credits. Check in was quick, painless and the clerk was helpful with tourist questions and directions. The room was spacious and well equipped. If you are on a budget watch the "extras" though. A Pepsi from the in room refrigerator is $4.00. Since valet parking was $47.00 a day (not to mention tips) I researched parking options and drove across the street (Propark 520 Mason) but you must drive around the block to access as Mason is one way. My rate was $27 a day with in/out privileges but we never used it. Preferring to use the Muni system to explore. On Saturday evening there was a free finger food reception in the Sky Lounge for "Premier Members" , which my son is, so my wife and I went up there for some mini prosciutto sliders, flimsy french fries and a cheese/veggie spread. I spied several liquor bottles on the counter, mixed up a couple of rum and cokes and was surprised as we left when the attendant said it was an "honor bar" and I had to sign for the drinks. (There was no signage). Oh well, $17.00 for a couple R&C's while watching the setting sun in SF when everything else was free, I'm not complaining. There is a computer/business center and wifi is available throughout the hotel but you will be charged $.49 a minute. Instead in the Sky Lounge we found a computer and caught up there for free. Since we didn't pay for our stay I can't comment on the value of the JW Marriot but I will say it's a Grand Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: KiwiShiraz
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights - very pleased to be able to check in early and have a room available mid morning. Rooms a good size with a wonderful large comfortable bed. All staff were very pleasant and extremely helpful. The hotel is located very close to Union Square and within easy walking distance of the Ferry Building. This is our second visit and is our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Much better stay than Union Square Marriott”
Reviews.Author: nhfiremanpaul
Reviews.Content: I think the title says it all. I spent 3 days at the Union Square Marriott then finally got sick and tired of the lack of service. So I packed my bags and came here. I found the concierges here a lot more pleasant to deal with. The beds were great the rooms were clean and the service was top notch! So glad I moved here.

Reviews.Title: “Very big... Very good location... Nice views”
Reviews.Author: OutInTheStreet
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott in downtown San Francisco for 2 days and was surprised and what a nice place this was. Upon check in they upgraded me to a very big suite with a beautiful view on a high floor. Did not even request it.... Now that is great customer service. As usual, the valet charges are very high, and there is not much street parking, but that is to be expected. Staying here puts you nearby to many tourist attractions, many restaurants, public transportation, and pretty much anything you would need to see in SF. There are plenty of things within walking distance. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but we had the worst room in the hotel Room 501”
Reviews.Author: lagunakb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, and we have stayed there before. We were assigned to room 501. We arrived early and they were nice enough to give us a room; maybe it was the only one available. The bathroom was tiny(shower, no tub, one sink). There was ONE place to sit; at the desk. No chair or couch. It was like thye forgot about this room. Luckily we did not spend much time there. City noise is to be expected in SF but we were 5 stories up, directly over the trash disposal, which waas empited at 5 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ProfandMom
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night with my 13 year old when we were visiting San Francisco before going to Sacramento to see family. The rooms are very nice with luxurious bathrooms and linens and comfortable beds. Everything was clean. We were on the 16th flood and did not hear much street noise, so if noise is an issue, request an upper floor. All the staff we talked to--bellmen, concierge, front desk--were helpful. Our room was ready for early check-in when we arrived about 12:30, and they stored our bags for the day after we checked out. One of the bellmen also gave me great directions so that we could avoid some of the hills when we were walking in the city. Our rate included breakfast. I got the buffet--which was great if you like fresh fruit. They had beautiful strawberries, peaches, blueberries, raspberries and more--all fresh and just great. My son ordered off the menu and enjoyed his food as well. It is expensive, but then again San Francisco is expensive, so that's somewhat expected. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JamesBrett
Reviews.Content: Great, great location!!! But if you or your spouse is a high end shopper, stay away! :) Rooms were nice/adequate, prices were good, parking is very high, but that is San Fran. My only issue was the housekeeping staff was very, very, very aggressive. Nice concierge lounge with a friendly staff and a great concierge in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A Platinum Experience”
Reviews.Author: Hercules750
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel in an excellent location near EVERYTHING - Theatre, galleries, shopping, transportation and food. Luxurious accommodations, pleasant and attentive staff. Parking is expensive but I'd stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bevchris
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here. We booked a studio room which was comfortable. The hotel is well located for exploring SFO. It is a large chain hotel though some as you would expect lacks the personal touch. Having said that our stay here was comfortable. Our main concern with our stay was that the fire alarm went off in the early hours on one morning, we evacuated our room and made our way outside. During this time we did not see one staff member to direct us and outside there were no staff to tell us what was happening. In the end it was a fire dept staff member who told us it was a false alarm and we could return to our room. It was concerning that no Marriott staff were around.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed, I cried.”
Reviews.Author: travelbum16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the JW Marriott in San Francisco for my milestone birthday getaway and I had such high expectations. We booked through his Marriott Elite Rewards line and were told that special notes had been made regarding our special occasion, corner room, high floor, etc, upgrades etc. When we arrived, I had really high expectations considering we'd (foolishly) used way too many Marriott rewards points for the quality of hotel. I was disappointed at every turn. Our room (so so), our view (eh), housekeeping (minimal), the location (sketchy and blah), the bed (hard as a rock), the service (non existent, in our case - not even a "Happy Birthday" at check in our cheesy card like most hotels do), the restaurant/bar (FIFTY dollars for an average tasting, tiny flatbread pizza and two disgusting drinks from the bar). I'd built up so much excitement throughout a month of planning that while we sipped disgusting drinks on the night of birthday in the lackluster hotel lobby, I cried. And I am not a crier. If you are a business traveler, you'll probably like this hotel okay. If you're visiting San Francisco for pleasure, sightseeing, a romantic getaway - this hotel is NOT for you. It's bland and generic and San Francisco is a vibrant, alive, unique place - you deserve to stay somewhere that reflects the pulse of the city herself. Note: Our room faced Post St. and it was VERY noisy. We could hear people screaming and sirens blaring ALL NIGHT long. If you're like me and are a light sleeper, be sure to ask for a room on the back or sides of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay anyplace else”
Reviews.Author: Smartabano
Reviews.Content: We loved it here. Traveled with my 88 year old mother for her birthday before we headed up to Northern California to see her brother in Mendicino, Stayed two nights at the JW at her brother's suggestion (he is a native californian and we are from the East). The lobby was spectacular with the dancing women sculpture to the external/internal elevators going up to the rooms. We had a room with a "city view" and I highly recommend it. The room was very clean and comfortable and had an especially beautiful marble bathroom with a separate shower closet from the tub/sink area. The restaurant was very, very good - food was beyond compare with a breakfast full of fresh quisine both cooked and off the vine (fruits). If I return, I will stay here without a doubt - please take my word for it!

Reviews.Title: “Bland and boring”
Reviews.Author: cappuccino9
Reviews.Content: Big, impersonal hotel but clean and spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but lacks amenities”
Reviews.Author: Wifey2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel for its great location and our good experiences at other JW Marriott properties. The concierge was perfect with all recommendations and when I left my make up bad in our cab on the way to the airport, the door man called the cab and he brought it back to me at the airport. However, I was disappointed with very minor issues. People chose JW Marriott because of the high feel of the beds, robes, toiletries, etc. I had to ask for shower caps, a working hair dryer, bath gel, and even the standard slippers you get in every other JW Marriott. These are small things that I've come to expect, and was sad to see was not standard at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge is excellant.”
Reviews.Author: brwthecpa
Reviews.Content: Room and staff were great but Darlene, the concierge, is excellant. She assisted us with great restaurant, show and tour plans.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant "boutique" Marriott”
Reviews.Author: tarzanldy
Reviews.Content: We are big Marriott fans and have stayed at a couple of their other properties in San Francisco. This was a welcome surprise...an elegant boutique experience. The property is stunning and although the rooms are set around an open atrium, the noise does not filter to the rooms. We were there Easter vacation week and purposely selected what we hoped would be a quieter location in Union Square in a smaller Marriott (300 plus rooms) We were not disappointed. The lobby is open but has intimate seating areas throughout, several with individual tv's. The staff were very accommodating..especially Michael the conciege. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and varied and included individual omelets prepared. The rooms were large for San Francisco with upgraded bathrooms. The fitness center has wonderful equipment with several treadmills and elipticals. For a few extra dollars than a cab, we took the hotel limousine to the airport..well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at JW marriott”
Reviews.Author: kst1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a business trip to SF and stayed at this hotel. Very convenient location- a block from powell street and Union Square and a nice 10 minute walk to Moscone Center. Stayed in a spacious suite on 20th floor. Nice room with a comfy bed; 38 in. LCD TV etc. The morning breakfast (buffet) was excellent. Its pricey- about $25 but we had a special as it was included in our room rate of $205/night. The staff from front desk to concierge to bell hops were all courteous and friendly. A few things I didnt care for- had to pay (12.95/day) for internet; ridiculous valet parking rate of $51/day (I guess it is like that all over San Fran downtown) and the stocked minibar. If you took an item out for more than 15 sec, you would be automatically charged. I had a 2.5 yr old with me, so just had the hotel staff empty out the minibar right after check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but stay at club level”
Reviews.Author: Canatravellers
Reviews.Content: Good central location especially for shopping. No need for a car in the city - take a taxi or transit. Service overall was extremely prompt and courteous but we've read the other reviews and maybe it's because we opted for club level which included access to a lounge for snacks & breakfast as well as free wi-fi from the room. Generally good stay although we did also upgrade to a suite on check-in so maybe it's just that we paid for it. Have stayed at the Ritz SF in the past and while this doesn't compare, JW was obviously more reasonably priced. Make sure to budget for the room tax and other add-ons (some type of SF improvement charge) when comparing prices (our room tax was $70 or so). Breakfast included at club level was mediocre and the club room itself was a bit run down but did have a computer and printer for boarding passes. This was just an overnight spot to catch our flight out the next day and worked very well for that. If staying in SF for longer, might be better to check other options. Omni reviews looked great but it was fully booked for the night we were in SF. Don't rely on the cable car for fast and reliable transportation. We almost missed our Alcatraz cruise because there was a disruption due to a police emergency going and then on the way back it broke down and we ended up walking seven blocks back to Union Square. They don't seem to run particularly regularly and the line-ups tend to move slowly and/or unpredictably but if you have the time, an experience not to be missed. Alcatraz audio tour was outstanding - worth booking way in advance. We are recommending it as a stopping point in or out of the airport for reasons discussed, but not for an extended stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, only praise”
Reviews.Author: stepback
Reviews.Content: My husband was staying here on business, so it was a combination Business/Leisure trip for us. I found the hotel public areas and our room to be spotless. Our room was on the 5th floor, which I was hesitant about at first due to noise concerns. The noise was never a problem. Huge room- the bathroom was bigger than some city hotel rooms. I must give praise to Michael, the conceirge, who assisted me in renting a car for a day trip North and who arranged for an airport shuttle for me. He was professional, knowledgeable, and so helpful. Nothing but praise for the JW Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Irksome, not fatal flaws”
Reviews.Author: travelingmother
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and found it to be an excellent combination of location, value, and amenities. This time we are not so sure. Kudos though to the woman who called us (Sylvia, Stella...sorry I didn't write the name down) ahead of time to welcome us. That was superb customer service, and she is a great asset to this hotel. However, even her excellent customer service doesn't make up for other failings. 1. Valet parking was +50$ (with taxes) which, even for the city, seems ludicrous. We never even took our car out. 2. There is only one comfortable chair to sit on. The desk chair is excellent for computer work, but for cocktails and visiting doesn't do the job. 3. Charging for the Internet is ludicrous. If we had stayed a few blocks away at the Courtyard by Marriott it would have been free. In this era, charging for the Internet is like having to put quarters in the box to make the TV play or the bed shake. 4. Thank God that the windows open, because this hotel is like an oven inside. Even in the dead of winter (and yes, SF does get cold in winter) we could not have survived without having the windows open full tilt. Open windows also helped with the pervasive smell of mold (which is still better than cigarette smoke of course, so Thank You Marriott for blazing that trail.) 5. No ice machines. In the US. Really? When we travel abroad we expect that, but not here in the US. The "butler" service does gladly bring you your allocation of 12 ice cubes of course. Fortunately, there are several Walgreens nearby, and you can buy a 3-pack of ice for less than 3$. And there is no tip required. 5. The bathroom has nice stone work which is going to deteriorate quickly because they don't clean the mold out of the grout. I mentioned this last year when we stayed, we had a different room this year, and the problem was the same. A little Tilex would go a long way. 6. The towels and bath rugs were frayed. Like mine at home actually. But I wouldn't charge someone $200 a night to use mine.:) 7. Check in was S-L-O-W and we arrived about 7:00 pm,, well after the onslaught. And there was only one person ahead of us. And she was checking out. Check-out (once again) could not be accomplished through the TV. Why bother to pretend to offer technology that clearly never works? Overall, there are so many other choices in this area that next time we will want to try something else. Probably we will select one of the "Orchards" properties.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: rrvj4
Reviews.Content: Great hotel... great area! San Fransisco has so many different places to explore. Loved the prison.. wharf.. little italy and china town. The bridge is amazing! people are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service was terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvpriya03
Reviews.Content: we had a party of 11. Five of them being children. We arrived on Christmas Day. The staff was very cold and the restaraunt was even worse. They acted like they had never seen children before. It is not worth the money if you are travelling with small children!!! We stayed at several ones along the way in California the best one with excellent service is the Marind del Rey Marriott!!! I highly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: staxtics
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful lobby and rooms. The service was good and the bathroom in the guest room have a unique look. Location was very good it's located close to Union Square and there are quite a number of restaurants along the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Union Square Location, Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveller45
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great service and location. Close to the cable car turnabout and shops. Stay in the Studio suites if you are travelling with your family and the free breakfast promotion cannot be beat. The only negative is that there is not a "private" toilet room in the bathroom which is pretty standard when staying in a suite. Kids loved riding the glass elevators up to our 19th floor location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality, everything you expect of a JW”
Reviews.Author: mmppwwzz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September on a weekend away. Weekends in downtown San Francisco are curious - hordes of tourists from all over the world give downtown give a somewhat theme park feel to the city. The absence of locals detracts from the experience, but that being said, the JW Marriott is exceptionally well located right near Union Square, and not too far from the BART/MUNI on Market. I arrived to SFO, and walked to the JW from Powell Station. Don't let anyone tell you that you have to take a cab to/from SFO or Oakland airport. Unless you have industrial sized luggage, take BART from the airport. Arriving early in the morning, I tried for an early check-in, but the room wasn't ready. This isn't a huge gripe except Marriott has an option for early check in - subject to availability. I wish they would simply remove this option since there's really only downside for the hotel. It creates an expectation for the traveller and makes the hotel say 'no' to something on first impression. Notwithstanding, they were very gracious to take our bags and we went sightseeing in the meantime. The room was exceptional. Sometimes the Marriott interiors are so generic it's impossible to tell whether you are in Bangkok, Boston, or Bangalore. This is different - great pictures with SF themes and a true luxury edge to the room made this very special. Service was very good - I ordered a wine and cheese platter which came promptly as promised. The cheeses were excellent quality, Stilton, Camembert and Jarlsberg and beautifully presented. I travel a lot and it's clear they pride themselves on going the extra mile here. Downsides: I don't blame the specific hotel for the early check-in disappointment, but Marriott really does need to give better guidance as to how likely it is. The only other problem was all elevators were not fully functional which led to some delays lining up for the elevator, but this was minor. Upshot is: An excellent quality five star hotel which meets all expectations. I do recommend travelers to SF venture farther afield than downtown and explore places like the Mission, Haight, and Castro to get more of a real SF flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: gpec24
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the JW Marriott for a long weekend in which a family member was getting married. We had an easy check in and the front desk staff was very accomodating. They answered all my questions and went above and beyond to help me when I needed it. The rooms were spacious for my DH and I. The bathroom was lovely and updated with granite counters and separate shower and tub. The beds were comfy and the TV had a good selection of channels. I ordered room service without any problems and my room "valet" was very nice. The wedding was also at the hotel. The ceremony was so nice and the wedding planner seemed very organized. The ballroom is gorgeous and the food was amazing! I am used to a lot of food being served at the cocktail hour but the wedding planner said they only order one passed item per person (So if you have 4 passed items, you are alloted only 4 pieces of food)...needless to say, we were ready to eat our dinner! It was a fantastic wedding and the bride and groom seemed so happy with everything! Parking was tremendously expensive...$40 per night. And as with most hotels, there were a lot of hidden charges. For example, if you took out a juice from the mini bar for more than 15 SECONDS, they charge you. Or they charge you if you put anything into the fridge.

Reviews.Title: “This is a JW Marriott?”
Reviews.Author: Beanthere1000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an ideal location, adjacent to Union Square - and has an impressive atrium-style lobby with elevators that soar above you into the floors above. That was the high point - and our first impressions were quickly extinguished by several cleanliness and service issues throughout our stay. Even more importantly, the high-rise hotel abounds with hazards to young children with some windows that are too easily opened by curious toddlers. In my in-laws' room, the casement windows could be opened entirely - without any stops or locks of any kind. It was frightening and shocking that a hotel of this stature would allow such a hazard to go unmitigated (Room 1109). Our room, 1111, had windows that were easily opened by youngsters - but had stops on them. Still, the window opened widely enough so that a small child might be able to slip their legs through - so we were still quite jittery about ever allowing our daughter to get too near them. The cleanliness of the hotel was also a big problem. On arriving to our room, and using the toilet for the first time, I noticed some "resi-doo" under the seat that I had just lifted. Disgusting. Also, the glass shelves adjacent to the sink looked like they had not been cleaned in weeks. The brown-colored granite may have been nice when the hotel was new - but coupled with my toilet discovery, dirty shelves and dim lighting - I got the creeps. Once in the shower, the water pressure was SEVERELY lacking. And I know everyone is trying to save water, but why do we need to be subjected to water flow that more closely resembles an eye-dropper? The gym contains some unusual and awkward equipment is kind of dirty. Definitely not a fitness "club" - but a smallish room packed with mostly treadmills, elliptical machines, etc. Go someplace else - this hotel looks like a Marriott on the surface, but operates more like a Holiday Inn. There are way too many options in SF than to pay full fare for ecomomy class.

Reviews.Title: “Could NOT have been more perfect!”
Reviews.Author: seeitandbelieveit
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott will rank in my top 3 hotels of all time! Everything was absolutely perfect. I just needed a leisure hotel for 2 nights, and Pricelined this hotel for $99 a night. However, my stay was priceless. The front desk staff was top notch, the conceirge was bang on with suggestions, and the room....ahhhh, the room. Could not be improved upon.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: SGrose
Reviews.Content: Room was impeccable and club lounge had everything I needed for breakfast. Front desk staff was very helpful and polite. Excellent location to everything. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Hotel for Business or Leisure”
Reviews.Author: sandk06
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here on multiple occasions for both business and leisure travel and the JW Marriott San Fran excels at providing a solid experience. I am a very frequent business traveler (120+ nights a year) and this hotel has the right mix for me. Nice concierge lounge, good fitness center with weights and newer cardio, good area/neighborhood, great desk setup w/ herman miller chairs, and a comfortable bed. I get a great corporate rate, so I can't comment on cost/benefit. I am a loyal marriott guest and this is a top hotel in their group.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, good service”
Reviews.Author: Fe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel attending a meeting which was held on-site. Piece of cake getting to the hotel from the airport on BART. Rapid check-in, although our two adjacent rooms were not ready at the time. Rooms are spacious and well-appointed. No real views. On the 11th floor, the room was quiet. I always love in-room coffee and the little one-cup device was perfect. Huge, comfortable bed. Good work desk and task chair. Didn't try the food in their restaurant, but the breakfast food at the conference was excellent. Easy walking to Union Square and Chinatown. Easy access to public transportation. Many decent restaurants in the area, within a 3 block radius. Lots of shopping, also.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelerfromsj
Reviews.Content: We booked a “city view” room, and also requested a high floor, which we got (floor 16). The view isn’t the greatest (see pictures), but much better than looking at the wall of another building! The room itself was large, newly appointed, and of course had that great Marriott bed. The bathroom was the best part- spacious, lots of shelf space, mirrored walls, separate tub, etc. The atrium with glass elevators was gorgeous. The location is perfect for tourists- just one block from Union Square. One really nice feature if you are driving to this hotel is that it has a driveway on Mason Str. where you can turn in and leave your car for valet parking; at a lot of the other hotels in that area, you just have to try and find a place to pull over on the street in front of the hotel (always fun in downtown traffic). The valets were friendly and helpful, as were the receptionists. Highly recommended overall.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: hlsgolf
Reviews.Content: This is one of the beautiful hotels in San Francisco (and I have stayed at many) with a perfect location, lovely and rapid service, gorgeous room that looked brand new and a bed to die for. The bathroom was huge and gorgeous with a full bath that also had a hand sprayer and a separate shower with a full power shower head that rained down wonderfully. New flat screen LED TV (40"). Small downside is that they charge for the in room safe which I found odd although they do offer one at the front desk. The reception desk is small, but the people are very efficient. Not sure what would happen in "rush hour." I will stay here from now on. Just 2 blocks off Union Square on Post. Oh...a nice little touch was that the area outside where one might wait for a car or to meet up with friends has a comfy seating area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, comfortable room with great bedding.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle219
Reviews.Content: Great service-all the staff were extremely helpful especially the doormen and the concierge. Location had easy access to all tourist attractions. Room was clean, quiet and had the usual comfy marriott bedding-we need good pillows to sleep. After a day of walking the city, sit in front of the fireplace and have a drink. Nothing we didn't like.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was typical, with a couple of small missteps”
Reviews.Author: chefgrfx
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in good union square location. As usual, I didn't have my profile requested extra towels, or fridge (minibar is stocked and not for personal items). As platinum elite, I was able to access VIP lounge, which is NOT ideal for leisure trips, as it was closed on weekends, ends early (9:30am I think) and was mostly a continental with scrambled eggs. No voucher for alternate to breakfast was offered. What rational does marriott use when considering wi-fi or internet access? Stay at a courtyard for $150 a night and get wi-fi for free, but stay at JW for $350 a nightand get nickled and dimed for an additional $25/night? Starbucks is across the street giving free wi-fi for a $2.50 purchase in case you hate paying so much for something that should be free. Next, Marriott continued to drop the ball by not informing guests in advance of rennovations on one of the 4 elevator shafts, and the outside awning. Noise and delays were minimal except for smal wait for elevator. But is was unfortunately the second time in a row this company which flawlessly communicates any and all marketing opportunities in advance of your stay, failed to communicate rennovations in advance. They can't seem to get this right for me, especially when staying for pleasure. The sirens never stopped, and despite the 19th floor room, the thin glass reminded us constantly, that we were in a city. In summary, the hotel was so-so. The view was OK (unless in VIP lounge), the location was fine, and the parking was a rape at $45/night despite other private garages in the area offering rates at half that. I would stay elsewhere if value is a concern for you, but if $350/night for an average stay doesn't concern you, then you will be satisfied with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about.....”
Reviews.Author: funtrippinsacto
Reviews.Content: The property is nice but the staff is average. They didn't smile and never went out of their way to be helpful. In fact, we booked a room that came with VIP King Tut tickets. They should have given them to us at check in, but had to go down to the lobby twice to pick them up. We were so excited to be spending 2 days of fun in San Francisco that anything would have been appreciated. Nothing special....and the $55 a night to park the car is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use the mini-bar or plan on sleeping!!”
Reviews.Author: Hove_Windsurfer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights on business. The room was fine, the staff were excellent and the location very good. However, the windows were like paper and kept neither wind or noise out. I was 9 stories up and you could hear everything from the street below, and I didn't get a good night's sleep. The frames seemed old and were metal with gaps. Also, they failed to put a price list in my minibar (I suspect deliberately, although couldn't prove it). If they had I wouldn't have had any beer. I'm used to minibar prices being inlfated and expected maybe $6-8 but $12 inlcuding tax for a little can of beer!!! They were seriously abusing me and I would never ever ever ever stay at a Marriott (or a partner) again after this rip off experience, and considering I spend so much time in hotels, that is quite a bit of business they are missing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay on every level!”
Reviews.Author: jenrobbo
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9 yr old daughter and myself stayed at the Marriott from 22 - 28 Aug 2009. When we checked out it was like leaving family. From the Bell hop, concierge, front desk, cleaners to room service they were all so delightful, professional, friendly and helpful. Our room was immaculate, spacious and comfy, the decor tasteful. The bed and bed linen were dreamy, I wanted to bring the pillows home. We had room service dinner only once and it was well priced and delicious. I would highly recommend this wonderful hotel to anyone and if in San Francisco again will definitely be checking back in with my 'family'.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 40th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Tootbelle
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Staff saw to our every need so graciously. The location was perfect. Matt Ordway went way beyond expectations to find the perfect restaurants, make the reservations, provide transportation. We like Marriott but this was exceptional. AND the new "look" is fun.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the JW Marriott Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Minikath
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the JW. Everything about it was fabulous! We had two rooms. They happily held our luggage until the rooms were ready, as we arrived before check in time. The front desk staff was polite and very friendly. The rooms were quite large, bed was so comfortable and everything about the hotel was immaculate! Very modern and beautiful decor! Concierge lounge had wonderful views of the city and was a great place for a snack and to relax outside of our rooms. Well worth any upgrade fees. Darlene the Concierge was so pleasant and helpful with directions, restaurant suggestions and getting us a rental car large enough for six during a very busy tourist season. Any staff member we asked for directions was ready with a highlighter to outline for us on the maps that the hotel has available. Jesse the Front Desk Manager was equally as helpful and pleasant and went out of her way to provide us with a truly great experience at the hotel!!!! Great hotel, fabulous location with shopping and restaurants everywhere, as well as easy access to any form of public transportation. Would highly recommend staying here during your next trip to San Francisco, and we will recommend to all we know. We will definately be back ! Thank you to the entire staff for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...and the hotel's not bad either!”
Reviews.Author: umwife11
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to lie --one of the biggest reasons we chose to stay at the JW was because I had a plethora of Marriott Rewards points to use and a good friend said she'd had a great time while staying there. That was enough for us and it turned out we, like our friend, made a good choice. The hotel was a perfect home-base for our six night stay. The room was plush and comfy with a great bathroom; the service from check-in to check-out was great; we got some incredibly good advice from the concierge and had a pretty nice stay overall (We were even pleasantly treated to the hotel's car service the night of my birthday dinner.
