Maybe the fact we were dressed to the nines helped? Who cared either way; we came downstairs asking for a taxi and got a personal town car ride. That felt pretty glam!) The location itself cannot be beat. We were just a few blocks' walk to every form of public transportation imaginable...MUNI, buses, trains, cable cars, street cars. All were very easily within reach for us. The one caveat...parking. Yes, it's incredibly expensive. We paid $45 a night, which just felt like highway robbery, but I gather that's pretty standard at many of the hotels in San Francisco. Which is one reason that on our next trip to the City by the Bay, we'll be relying solely on public transport. Unless you're making some day trips out to wine country or other spots (like we did), you probably will NOT need the car at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to JW name”
Reviews.Author: ODtravelers
Reviews.Content: Overpriced; just average in everything else. Parking $50 a night; drinks high priced and not good; no papers delivered to rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW from 7/29 - 8/4, had a great experience. The staff was very helpful with restaurant reservations, directions to attractions and overall questions. The room was very nicely decorated and very comfortable. Michael and Matthew at the conceige desk couldn't do enough for you. The only disappointing moment was when I asked the front desk if we could hold on to the room a little longer after the check out time since we weren't being pickup for the airport until 8:00pm our ladt day, I was told by an employee the hotel wasn't full and they will normally allow this I was also told to ask Antonio at the front desk, sothat's what I did I asked Antonio and he asked me my room number and then said no the hotel was booked. I got the feeling if I had stayed in one of the rooms that cost more he would have given me the room for a couple more hours I was willing to pay. Overall wonderful hotel and a wonderful trip. Love San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: HongKongJules
Reviews.Content: The location's great as it's near Union Square and Westfield Shopping Centre! Service was good and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location for Union Square and trolley”
Reviews.Author: 3kidtravels
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, bathroom was nice. Room was a little loud facing Mason, but it's a city. Staff was nice and attentive but lacked answers regarding the public transportation. Nice overall.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient service, good location, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: CSWaco
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights...bellmen, valet, concierge were all helpful & efficient. We didn't really use the hotel much for anything other than sleeping so I can't speak for the restaurant or business services. Internet in the room worked fine (though I hate paying for it since many hotels offer it for free). I know better than using the minibar. Fortunately, there's a plethora of wal-greens in the area to stock up on water or snacks. I wish the pillows were better. I'm not a huge fan of down pillows. They had firm ones too but they were like gigantic rocks. I guess it's hard to please everyone on bedding. I read so many reviews about SF hotels & their claustrophobic rooms but this wasn't too bad. Overall, the room was nice (does need more drawers to unpack in). Very quiet in terms of noise from the hotel, but could hear street noise even from the 8th floor. I don't think the hotel had a spa but the concierge hooked up my wife & friend at a nearby spa, so no complaints there. I got a great deal on this trip & would definitely stay here again if the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “The best ever”
Reviews.Author: Nelsonian
Reviews.Content: Super service from entry court on up. Room gorgeous with view to the West, almost could see China in the distance. Needed "early arrival" room which exec gal arranged. We needed rack of lamb for dinner, concierge found just the right restaurant for our needs. A perfectly splendid trip. Hope to be back soonest...

Reviews.Title: “Almost a "JW" Marriott”
Reviews.Author: mheister
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attended a conference in SF at the JW Marriott. The property is nice with a modern, open flair. But there were a couple of shortcomings. First, the rooms were nice, but there were not enough drawers to unpack luggage for a 4 day visit. The mini-bar is adequately stocked, but the prices are even more outrageous than one normal finds in a hotel room mini-bar. On top of that, there is a "15 second rule" posted in the door of the fridge that, in essence, says that if you remove any item from the mini-bar for more than 15 seconds, you WILL be charged for that item (plus the approriate tax and $20 "re-stocking fee). The towels and linens were very rough on one's skin. Next, our one dining experience at the hotel restaurant was acceptable, however the food service during the conference (especially breakfast) was poor. The food was usually cold and a bit greasy - not what one would expect in a city that touts organic foods and a healthy lifestyle! The staff was very friendly and accomodating - an expectation in a JW Marriott. Overall - a good visit, but not quite what we would have liked. This property not a JW Marriott - but it's ALMOST there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Deanna9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a night in December when he had a business trip of SF. The front desk staff was very nice and upon hearing it was my birthday, they upgraded us to a corner room on one of the high floors, so we had a beautiful view and a larger room. The rooms are nice, clean and beds are comfortable. The bathroom was nice sized as well. The hotel itself is modern (kind of sterile feeling). It is close to Union Square and a couple blocks from Chinatown. If you are travelling with kids, I would recommend staying closer to Fishermans Wharf, but for adults visiting, this is a nice choice.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug809
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE HOTEL!! VERY, VERY, VERY bad service. Hotel associates are not helpful and make excuses for their lack of service. The hotel does not live up to the Marriott name. Even the managers were horrible. Front desk managers and associates were slow, not friendly, and not knowledgeable about the surrounding areas. Not worth the price. Restaurant Level 111 was DEAD, food was overpriced and tasted just ok. Computers available for guest use were not working and when we asked for assistance the Front Desk Manager was useless and did not call anyone to help therefore we were unable to print our boarding passes. First night we were there plug to tub didn't work. Next day when houskeeping cleaned they dismantled the drain and then just left it so we had to call to have it fixed. Door attendants were not friendly. Virtual concierge and concierge were not efficient, not friendly, not helpful with planning. Contacted the virtual concierge for tickets to an event which ended up being sold out, concierge as unable to provide any alternative or suggestions. Called concierge to arrange airport shuttle they were busy and told us they would call us back. They never called us back. We love SF but would NEVER stay at the JW Marriott EVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Great Location, a San Francisco gem at Union Square”
Reviews.Author: JonyTumbles
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great amenities...great location... and generally excellent service. We used points to offset a few nights cost...and the hotel treated us like royalty. It was an amazing experience...with a high floor corner room with a great view of the city and the bay in the distance. The hotel staff were friendly and very accomodating, and seemed genuinely pleased we had selected thier hotel to celebrate out 30th anniversary. The room (small suite) was large for a city hotel and very clean...smelled great. The bar (Level III) had a great open space with computers and a large fire place....needed after a cool windy day. In the morning the bar turns into a Star Bucks...also needed to start a busy day. The outside staff are always ready to help...getting a cab to/from the airport is not a problem...cost about $45 (same as car parkinging). Speaking of cars, there are several rental agencies within 2 short blocks....and within that same distance is a broad spectrum of shops (high end), Union Square, cable cars, Market Street and a huge mall (the San Francisco shopping center). If you have a shopper in the family, this is Nervana. The location of the hotel is great, because you are out of the rush but just steps away from clubs and shopping and public transit....including the Powel/Market cable car ($5 each way). We did not dine at the hotel, other than order the wine and cheese sampler "Best of San Francisco". We would not hesitate to return and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard By Marriott on Steroids”
Reviews.Author: nycthing
Reviews.Content: This hotel must be going bankrupt based on staff comments - I arrived late in the evening (around 10:30pm) but figured a JW Marriott would have room service to get a light dinner. Wrong! Operator told me they cut room service "because they couldn't afford it during these difficult economic times." Later I called the concierge a couple times, leaving messages - still waiting for a call back. Probably cut that service during these difficult times. There was a button in my room for butler service - pushed and left pushed and never heard from the butler. Probably cut that service during these difficult times. The good - good location near Union Square. If you don't know SF, the area is a little gritty at night should you walk in the wrong direction but you are a block from Union Square and all the shopping and restaurants. Also, the rooms are quite spacious and well appointed in that Marriott instituational quality. This is not a bad hotel but don't pay a premium for it - as a long time Marriott customer, the only difference between this hotel and a Courtyard is that they had a lobby bar and restaurant. Of course, there are some Courtyards with lobby bars and restaurants so maybe there was no difference. Again, don't pay a premium for this hotel but feel comfortable there if you find a cheap rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: citygirlontherun
Reviews.Content: Great for a weekend away - very convenient to public transport and SFO sites and attractions. Room was comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: KC_travels08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April '09 for 2 nights in conjunction with a business event. Although I'd say amenities are slightly below the other JW Marriotts where I've stayed, it was still very nice...more on par with a regular Marriott. Highlights include a modern lobby & lounge. Rooms feature an upgraded bathroom w/separate tub and shower and a large LCD HD TV. Some reviews have been critical of noise from adjoining rooms but I heard nothing during my stay, despite a reported "full house." I did not eat at the hotel's restaurant, but I did experience the hotel's food for breakfast, lunch, dinner and cocktails at a small business function. Food and service was outstanding! The hotel's location is convenient, near Union Square, but it is on the edge of the seedy Tenderloin district. As long as you don't venture too far in the wrong direction, you will be fine. My only complaint would be the slow internet response time I experienced. Internet rates were in line with other full-service hotels at $12.95/day that also included free local and long distance calls. Overall, a fine property that I would say is more suited to business travelers or couples, than families.

Reviews.Title: “Taken a turn for the worse”
Reviews.Author: skylarkMD
Reviews.Content: This hotel became a JW Marriott @ 2 years ago. New owners then 'remodeled' the bathroom by removing the TVs and tub showerheads. Gee, usually a remodel involves improvement. Also removed most of the dresser drawers to install a mini-bar (note says that you will be charged if an item is removed for more than 15 seconds, or if you store items in the mini-bar). Had to live out of the suitcases. Ice bucket was dirty, and ice machines are not available to guests. Must request ice be brought to the room. Few towels provided, and they did not look fresh. One of the highest internet rates I've seen - $6.95 for 15 minutes. Another card in the room stated that guests will be charged $250 if the room smells of smoke. Room service costs definitely on the high end. Rooms/charges not at all family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent rooms, average service”
Reviews.Author: ivanov0704
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in August 08 during our first leg of CA trip holiday. Hotel is located right downtown, a block away from Union Square. All the designer shops, malls, good choice of restaurants, china town – everything is pretty much nearby. Concierge was quite helpful and recommended good restaurants (we asked for Chinese, Mexican, Italian and Japanese and all were very good). When we stayed in the hotel, lobby was under construction, so could not really tell how it was. Gym is ok, but nothing special. One night people next room had a party so had to call in the front desk. Only after the started smoking (which is illegal in CA) they actually did something about it. Room service was way below average. And it really bugged me that everyone expects to get tipped (but I guess it is just how America works). Other than that, hotel was nothing special. I thought it was worth it as I was paying with Marriott points and location allowed to explore SF easily. But I would probably not stay there have I been paying cash.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to JW Marriott international hotel standard”
Reviews.Author: aioux
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointment. The service (from the bell boys/porters to the concierge) were not particularly effective and seemed either bored or disinterested. The hotel room was a nice size and I appreciated windows that actually opened. The bathroom had a similar style to other JW Marriott hotel room bathrooms (lots of mirrors and glass, brown granite or marble everywhere), but the dusty rose bathtub and toilet were rather odd and out of place. The bathroom looked it had been partially renovated... The hotel is a few blocks from the Powell BART station and near Union Square. Considering the quality and service of other JW Marriott hotels that I have stayed in around the world, this location falls far short.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: smopart
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a wonderful location in Union Square. Hotel was very elegant and clean. Rooms were large with very big bathrooms. The staff was very attentive and the valet parking was quick. Very comfy bed. Concierge was helpful. The butler button worked and the staff was quite fast with ice, wine openers, towels, etc. Would definitely stay at this magnificent hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, too expensive, not for families though.”
Reviews.Author: FlyonTime
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business to California so my wife and 9 month old son were traveling along. We stopped in San Francisco for a few leisure days. The hotel is nice with contemporary decor, friendly staff, and in a good location if you like shopping. The rooms are of average size. They were clean. The bathrooms were larger than I expected, although if you are tall beware of the shower head. We ordered room service. They got our order wrong all three times! The food was average to good, if you got what you ordered, but way overpriced - I don't care if I am in California or not. There are several good local restaurants nearby though. The beds are extremely soft. The rooms are quiet. The bell staff is very friendly and prompt with service. There is no pool at this hotel. There is also no place, other than your room, that is good to sit with children. The lobby is really cool to look at but not child/baby proof. You can only valet park at this hotel so get ready to get your wallet out because it is very expensive, near $50/day, plus tips for the guys. The neighborhood is definitely fine during the day. At night we were still comfortable out on the street but only because there were other people around. You will walk by homeless or beggers in this location. It also seemed there is a rather unsavory neighborhood not too far away in one direction. I would not have wandered too far at night, particularly because we had our baby with us. Overall this hotel would be great if you are traveling alone or with a girlfriend/boyfirend or spouse. It is chic. This hotel is not good for families, particularly families with young children. We would come back but not with children.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Bed, Nice Rooms, lots of outside noise”
Reviews.Author: brendanm14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a weekend in January for my wife's birthday. The hotel is a nice property but nowhere near some of the other JW Marriotts that I have stayed at but I think that has to do with those have been newly built while this one was taken over. The room was a decent size and the bed was out of this world. Had a nice LCD HDTV with HD programming which you don't see in all hotels these days. The location near Union Square cannot be beat! You are about a 5-10 minute walk away from the Square. We had dinner in the lobby bar the first night and the appetizers we had weren't bad (Garlic/Parm fries, Kobe beef sliders, and Chicken Satay,) We did not have breakfast at the hotel, ended up going to Starbucks just a couple of blocks down every morning. All in all, a nice place, great location and a wonderful bed!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly diasppointed - there are better options out there”
Reviews.Author: rvjakes
Reviews.Content: I usally travel to San Francisco a few times a year and usually stay at the Marriott or Westin. Since my company has preferred rates with Marriott, I thought I would try the JW on my latest trip, and despite the location near Union Square (which couldn't be beat), I have to admit that I was slightly disappointed. My trip started off badly and I had to wait nearly a half hour at reception while my reservation was "found" - - this was despite the copy of my travel itinerary and confirmation number that I provided. Not exactly the way you want to be greeted after a cross country flight, but could deal with that. Overall, I found the room to be very similar to other Marriotts across the country although the bathroom was a little nicer - surprising given the premium marque. However, my biggest complaint was due to the room that was ultimately found for me and which was adjacent to the fitness center. Several times during the early mornings that I stayed there (think 4am), I was awakened by several tremendous "crashes" that shook the wall (and consequently the bed frame) as if the 'Big One" had come. I later learned that my headboard was directly against the wall where the dumbells were located and some very rude people thought nothing of just dropping on the floor after use. IMHO, I would recommend staying at the Mariott on Market Street and pay a little extra for a corner or concierge room.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite SanFran Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mws215
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to San Francisco extensively over the past two years, and always try to book the JW. I love the hotel overall, from the large, beautifully furnished and decorated rooms, to the helpful and friendly staff. The room layout and decor are so different than the 'standard' hotels that I am always pleasantly surprised when I check in. The recent renovations to the lobby area seem to be following the recent Marriott trend towards "sleek and trendy" that I've noticed in other Marriott properties. However,it doesn't work 100% for me here..sometimes feel that I'm not young or hip enough to hang out in the bar area..but I do anyway ;-). I have only eaten in the restaurant a couple of times since the re-do, and the food is very good, but pricey. And while the rooms are frequently less expensive than other area Marriotts during the work week, to be honest I would have trouble swinging more than a night or two if my company wasn't picking up the tab. Then again, this is San Francisco..and a great location to boot. A block from Union Square and theaters. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: longwoodtravel
Reviews.Content: My wife,son, and I stayed for 5 nights in the end of August! we used marriott points and just loved the property! we got a corner room that gave us a king bed and a sofa bed for my son. We also was upgraded to the Concierge Level. most concierge levels offer a cont breakfast, this was more like a full breakfast buffet. at 5p or so out came cheeses and vegetables and at least 2 hot appetizers. staff at the hotel was knowledgeable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: amy77385
Reviews.Content: Better than expected. It's located just 3 minutes walk from Union Square where all the shopping is located. 7 minutes walk from F train which will take you down to Alcatraz Pier. The hotel is modern and clean. The registration check-in is located on 3rd floor so you'll need to take elevator up once you walk in. The lobby is very attractive and we were graciously upgraded to the 15th floor. The room seem to be newly renovated, modern decor, big window, big screen LCD tv, big king size with bed, large bathroom with tub and separate shower with rain shower shower head, and two bathrobes for use. The bed was comfortable for one person but having another person, you can feel the springs or bed bounce a bit. The window is single pane so you can hear the emergency vehicles passing at night and cars honking. The walls are thin that you can't tell if someone is knocking on your door or your neighbors, I could also hear someone cough, turn page of magazines next door, their conversations weren't as muffled. The room was clean and maid left 2 chocalates for us the next day. Room service was fast and friendly. I have an iPhone and could not get 3G in the room...The room had everything we needed. Overall, we were happy with the stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standards for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: bandogal
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is not at all up to the standards I have always found at Marriott at all levels. 1. A wad of hair was on the bathroom floor. 2.M&M stuck on the table under the memo pad. 3.a makeup bag under the drape left by a prior guest. 4. A badly broken bathroom glass towels that were rough and not very White. 5. Coffee served in the bar with the saucer full of slopped coffee and an attitude when the bar only had 3 other patrons and they had drinks already. 6. After putting on the butler button for ice I waited 30 minutes before calling the desk to send up ice. 7. I had to request cereal bowls and ceral spoons for breakfast and cheese was served without crackers. 8. The hotel charged 12 a day for WIFI and it is free at the less expensive Marriott brands. The front desk and Conceriage were terrific as were the men who maaned the front door. I would suggest you spend your money else where when in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great end to our holiday at the JW Marriott SF”
Reviews.Author: littev0ices
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott at the end of a holiday driving around California. I'm a Marriott Platinum member (i.e. I stay in Marriotts 100+ nights a year) so my treatment might not be typical for all guests. First impressions were 'hmm' - the hotel looks very nice, but, strangely the lobby was on the third floor, with the entrance on the first floor. As we were driving there we were also a bit stuck as the hotel's driving entrance is actually on Mason street, and due to SF's one way system this wasn't so easy to get back onto, so, if arriving by car try and get onto Mason/Post. Parking is expensive in San Francisco in general, you are better not bringing the car if you can avoid as you certainly don’t need it in the city. There is a Hertz location in the hotel, and there is also one on Mason street that is less than a block away as well. However, arrival was great, the hotel lobby is lovely, and the roof actually opens up all the way to the top of the hotel (21 floors). The elevators also look out on the same view, so it can be really nice to be travelling up to your room if you're on a high floor (or to the bar/rest area on the 21st floor). Got to our room on the 18th floor, it was nicely big, and had a nice view in that we could just see the bay and it is always nice to be high up. (See the photos on this review to see the view we had). The bed was a typical Marriott one (i.e. lovely and relaxing), the bathroom was very well presented with marble, bath robes provided (nb: one under the bathroom sink for some reason, the other in the wardrobe as usual) and a lovely shower. My wife also enjoyed the bath. The TV was also very nice - a huge 42" High def affair, with a lot of channels choice. As a nice touch the room also had a 'valet call' button - so you could press it and the valet would come to your room, a nice touch (a little like the 'butler bell call' in old style houses in England). The room also had an ipod base to play music around your room (didn't have one to know how well it works) We also had access to the club lounge, on the 21st floor, for breakfast and nibbles. It was quite busy, but, had amazing views of the city, a very comprehensive breakfast (more like an American breakfast than a continental one), and they'd even lend you a DVD player if you wanted. Service from the staff was great, and they even allowed us to check out late as our flight was in the evening. Everyone was very polite and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay - just a shame that it was only for a single night. Final point on location - though the hotel claims to be on Union square it is actually a block away... doesn't make any difference, but, a minor point. But, otherwise the hotel is in a great location - excellent shopping within a few blocks, the same with the cable cars. The area was also very safe late at night with lots of traffic and light in our view. We stayed at both this and the San Francisco Marriott on our trip, and this one is definately nicer, so, if we were coming back to San Francisco we'd try to stay here if possible (Bear in mind I'm loyal to Marriotts!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Rob CC
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the JW Marriott in San Francisco for any stay. My wife and I stayed there for a anniversary and received great service. We were greeted at check-in by Bianka, who was exceptionally nice and welcoming. The hotel has some construction (as of Sept. 2008) on the first floor (near the valet parking area), but it did not affect us in any way. We didn't hear anything from it or notice it, other than when we got in the elevator. The room was nice, with a great view of the city. Great TV and bedding, plus a high quality bathroom. The hotel was even VERY helpful in getting to a SF Giants baseball game .... the hotel car service took us right there! The location is good, a couple blocks from the cable cars, which take you everywhere a tourist would want to go. Taxicabs are also easily grabbed, if needed. We stayed with Marriott points (which was a steal given the price of some hotels in San Francisco), so I cannot comment on value for the various rates. Overall, I would strongly recommend this Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: 4states
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were really helpful and listened to our requests. The suite was nicely decorated and very comfortable. There were a few issues however they were resolved very quickly. Only issue they couldn't resolve was some noise from the disco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice digs, just no 'special' vibe”
Reviews.Author: bostonpies
Reviews.Content: I have nothing to complain about except I wanted more 'glamour' for my families' vacation. The room was very nicely appointed, albeit small for a family of 4 (why do so many hotels think that 2 double beds are good for 4 people, why not have queens?) The service was excellent, and mostly friendly or neutral, never bad. The location was good. It was just not special in any way, considering the money paid. Just felt like a very nice business hotel..... maybe that is all it is supposed to be.... where I would have preferred a destination luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the city”
Reviews.Author: hans911
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful and centrally located a block from Union Square. We were informed upon an early checkin that our room was not ready therefore we would be offered and upgrade to a suite which I humbly accepted. Beautiful comfortable room on the 17th floor. The staff was excellent from bellman to front desk and housekeeping. We walked and rode all over the city with my 5 year old and enjoyed coming 'home' to the tranquility of the JW Marriot in the afternoon. The fitness room was equipped well with cardio equipment and fair with weight equipment. We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, beautiful hotel, okay view”
Reviews.Author: laoptimist
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, both inside and out. We got an excellent rate using expedia. The hotel is located in union square, making it extremely convenient to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Room Without A View”
Reviews.Author: blondeyxxoo
Reviews.Content: Based on mostly favorable reviews we booked our room through Orbitz on very short notice. We had a late check-in on a Friday night, around 8:00 PM. I had requested 2 double beds and specified I would be traveling with my girlfriend . Upon check-in they basically said (looking down the end of their noses), "Too bad, there are only king beds. If you have a problem with that you need to take it up with your "booking company". " Although we had used a "booking company", with parking, our room was $355.00 per night. Not exactly a paltry sum in my book. I didn't really feel like we were being cheap in any way, but that is exactly how they made us feel. I definately had the distinct feeling that booking indirectly is looked down upon. We headed to the 8th floor, walked into our room and thought things might be looking up a bit. The room seemed spacious, and it appeared the bed was an Eastern King, so sleeping with my girlfried in the same bed 2 nights might not be as awkward as I thought. I proceeded over to the window to check out the view and was greeted by a solid wall of the adjacent building. I guess we would have to take that up with the "booking company" too. The last straw for me was breakfast on Sunday (our only meal with the hotel thankfully). We shared oatmeal, a fruit plate, muffin, and both had a latte. Our bill with tip, was $31.00. The oatmeal was beyond bad, we could barely choke it down. The fruit plate (one banana and a handful of berries) was $15. The bran muffin???????? I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. If this is the kind of treatment you get when using a booking company, I will be hard pressed to use them either.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Mayden
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel was in an excellent location to be able to walk to many of the places we wanted to explore. The hotel had undergone a major renovation and much of it appeared new. We thought the room was reasonably sized with a large flat screen tv and well stocked. The place was very clean and the maid service was very good. We echo some of the other comments that the front desk staff could be a little more friendly and informative and the same could be said for the concierge desk. Except for that, we enjoyed our stay and would go back to this hotel on our next visit to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay at JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: parissmiles
Reviews.Content: I am very tardy in recording this experience, which occured in late March of this year. The hotel is well-placed for getting around in the city by any means, and we felt quite comfortable in the Union Square area. The corner room near the top of the hotel was superb, as was the housekeeping staff. Despite construction being present, the staff made efforts to not allow it to be an impediment to our 5 day stay. The consierge staff was mistaken on their suggestions/ directions a few times, and provided out-dated information. At this hotel, we were very near excellent restaurants, shopping, and transportation within blocks of the hotel. American Airlines lived up to its reputation for tarnishing an otherwise enjoyable vacation in a beautiful hotel with a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: kevquan
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the JW Marriott in SF. San Francisco is a great trip if you're looking for a long weekend vacation. A few notes: - Cab from SFO to hotel which was located in Union Sq was about $35 dollars. As always, knowing approximate cab rates is always important so you don't get ripped off. - The JW Marriott for a luxury hotel is what you expect in a city like San Fran. Space is pricey, so the rooms were nice, but small. Large flat screen tv was a plus, but for a JW, the luxury was minimized a bit by the space. Also, the bathroom was fairly large, but felt very dated. Service is great though, with an in room butler button for your use. A few times I requested towels and other items, and a person came to our door in less than 5 minutes. As for the hotel itself, the restaurant and bar was undergoing construction which is scheduled to be done later this summer. Should be pretty nice as it'll be brand new. Hotel location was ok, union square doesnt have much 'sites' but a good shopping and walking area. Trolley cars and bus lines are just 2 blocks over, and the neighborhood is also walking distance to Chinatown, Nob Hill, the Financial area and a large mall as well. - As for attractions, make sure you hit the regular spots, nothing wrong with being touristy. I recommend: Chinatown is great for dinner (better dinner than breakfast to be found there) and the old fashioned bakeries are great. The Golden Gate Bakery has the best fresh egg custards. Alcatraz tour is pretty interesting, and you can purchase tickets in advance on the internet which gets you on the shorter "will call" line. For baseball fans, catch a Giants game. Even if the teams are just ok, tickets can be had cheap and you'll definitely appreciate the park. The food options are ridiculously great.

Reviews.Title: “Great but "not Wow"”
Reviews.Author: xyv1027
Reviews.Content: So I probably one of the few that am not giving this hotel 4 stars. Knowing the Marriott brand well I have even higher expectations for their flagship line, the JW Marriott hotels. I had a nice stay but have stayed at far nicer JW's in other cities. We arrived around 10pm and had to wait outside for someone (anyone) from the Bell Desk to valet our car. Next step was check-in and having never been to the hotel before, I didn't realize you had to go to the 3rd floor for check-in until I asked someone else on the 1st floor that looked about as lost as I did. Check in once we found it was quick and pleasant. We had a very well appointed room on the 16th floor, the bathroom was probably the nicest area in the room. I have seen Renaissance hotels (another Marriott line) and other JW's with nicer rooms; the look was fresh and modern but some of the furnishings looked a little too well used. Checkout was slow because the checkout through the in-room TV did not work and there was a lengthy line at the front desk downstairs. The concierge lounge breakfast was almost top notch and the concierge recommendations on area restaurants were most welcome. They continually advised us to avoid walking in the neighborhod late at night... for a reason I never understood. The neighborhood seemed fine to us with lots of people out, even after 12 midnight on a week night.

Reviews.Title: “extremely nice”
Reviews.Author: awdub
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while in town for a friend's wedding. We were very impressed with the location and the room, and will absolutely come back when we are in town again. Check-in is on the third floor. When we first arrived, we wandered around for a bit before we realized that we had to go upstairs. The one thing that the hotel does need to work on is its downstairs bell-staff - not only when we first arrived, but every time we entered and left the building, there were very few employees on the ground floor, and they seemed to be making a concerted effort to ignore the guests. Otherwise, service was very good. At check-in, the front desk gave us a masterfully worded note from the manager, explaining that it was the weekend of the gay pride parade, so there were a lot of wonderful activities in town, but guests needing to travel on Sunday should allow themselves extra time - it was beautifully done. The hotel decor was very nice, more modern than the typical JW Marriott, looked like it was just renovated. The lobby spaces, bar, etc. were very nice and fairly busy while we were there. The room was a good size, beautifully furnished, very large bathroom, good amenities, linens, and a very comfortable bed, large window, pretty good view, and very quiet. The location was great - close to Union Square, but a block or two away from the hectic masses.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations at the JW San Francisco…..”
Reviews.Author: ManyFunTravels
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great weekend stay at the JW before heading up to wine country. I had mixed feelings originally from reading postings about this hotel but decided to give it a try anyway. Actually we got a great bonus for staying the weekend we did. The hotel had a big relaunch party Friday night of their lobby restaurant that had been under renovation. All guest of the hotel were invited and it was a blast. There was music, live entertainment many hors d’oeuvres from sheared scallops to mini bar burgers, wine, champagne and cocktails which were all complementary! Now how did we luck up on this party in downtown San Francisco? Don’t know but I’m sure glad we did! The rooms were tastefully done with a modern décor. The bathroom was marble with a separate tub and shower. Since the recent renovation all rooms have a 42’ flat screen TV that I could appreciate. The location is great close to Union Square, easy to get around town from this place. The hotel is not that large overall and I felt the hallways were a little tight. I workout while traveling and the fitness area was adequate for an on the road workout. It’s equipped with ellipticals, treadmills, free weights and a few weight machines. If you’re looking for the hardcore workout you get at home you will need to inquire about a local gym. The concierge was awesome in recommending things to do in the area and sights to see! One great recommendation was to stop at La Taqueria while we were in the mission district. The best we’ve ever ate! The entire hotel staff was friendly and helpful during our stay. We had a great time and would definitely stay here again while in the Bay Area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: GWaily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott as the last stop on our honeymoon. The experience was great from the moment we arrived. We were greeted warmly with a big congratulations, and our room was upgraded. We were also given access to the club lounge, which was excellent. The room was very nice and spacious, and when we ordered room service it was of a high quality. The hotel is in a very convenient location and the service was excellent throughout our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel for a great stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gamecock93
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a three day weekend at the JW. The hotel and staff were terrific. The hotel has just gone through a complete renovation and everything is new and spotless. The room, bathroom, club lounge and lobby were all first-rate. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the Powell St BART station, Powell-Mason cable car turn-around and F-line streetcar. China Town is less than a 15 minute walk. I used points for this stay. Nice job, Marriott. I would defiinitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: NickysdadRF
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the JW Marriott this past April with our 6 and 10 year old kids who were out of school on spring break. The hotel is conveniently located a couple of blocks from Union Square. Our "executive" room was tastefully decorated and included a very comfortable king size bed, a sitting area that included a sofa bed, chair and tables, as well as a desk, 42" LCD TV and a minibar. The bathroom was great--tastefully done including a large tub and a separate shower. The hotel just went through a renovation and all of the decor (carpeting etc) is brand spanking new. The staff was very attentive, and the concierge desk was fabulous -- recommending everything from dining options to tours and directions. The only criticisms that I might have is that there isn't enough drawer space for clothing -- the hotel seems to primarily cater to business travelers (which is understandable) who stay for short periods of time. Additionally, the lobby was under construction and we were unable to appreciate it. All in, we loved the hotel and would definitely stay again on our next trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Love It”
Reviews.Author: Ginette
Reviews.Content: We love that hotel very nice good beb good service ,clean ,perfect location . For breakfast ect you are all around restaurent like Sears Finest dinner you all around good restaurent .Attraction walk every where the location was perfect . From Maine April 2008

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: HockeyFan09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott San Francisco the week of April 21st. We were greeted by a very friendly doorman and front desk girl. We were checking in very early (9am) and she offered us an upgrade to a suite at 50% off (someone had just cancelled their reservation). We took it and were so glad we did! The room was awesome. The bathrooms are fantastic and the beds are extremely comfortable (even my "mattress critic" husband thought they were great). The only renovations still happening at the hotel is the restaurant and that was no big deal since we rarely eat at hotel restaurants anyways. We did try the hotel food once and it was very good. The hotel seemed very busy with room service orders. The customer service was not notch, probably second only to the Four Seasons hotels. They have a butler button you can press in the room and they send someone up to your room. I don't think we waited more than 3 minutes each time we used it and we used it at least once a day. Every evening we ordered up some ice. We found that by the third night or so that they started to bring up the ice automatically when they did our evening turn down service. Great service! The had refreshments in the lobby, which varied depending on the the time of day. I tried out the pink lemonade and it was great. Very refreshing on a hot day. The location is awesome. So close to Union Square. The walk was about a minute long. I would certainly stay at this hotel the next time we get a chance to visit San Francisco. We were first time visitors and this hotel made our experience very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: meupnorth
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Great location right near shopping and dining of Union Square and the financial District. Walked most places even to the Ferry building at the piers and it was a nice flat walk from here. Room was very nice and clean with very comfortable king size bed and great bathroom. Staff was helpful and pleasant. Even though the hotel is under going renovations, we heard no building noise. The front desk arrival area is a bit underwhelming which I hope will change with the completion of the reno. My only complaint was on two occasions seeing dirty room service dishes laying out in hall for 8 or more hours straight (yuck). I would expect better from a JW Marriott property I would stay there again next time I am in San Francisco though as the pluses definitely outweighed the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adoraoo7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, centrally located, and very clean. I'd definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: BeatriceBloom
Reviews.Content: The room was huge! The linens were luscious; I loved being in the ultra soft pillow bed with comforter and pillows around me. The bathroom was small but it was fine for just one person. It might have been tight for two. I loved the sundries so much that I ordered the lotion on line. I was there for business, and I can say that coming back to the hotel was truly a retreat. Great location. Staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott is First Class”
Reviews.Author: OCdrama
Reviews.Content: The location of the JW Marriott is ideal! Close (1-4 small blocks)to all Union Square and Westfield mall shopping, restaurants, cable car, and Hertz rental car, which is good when you choose to rent a car to explore the city and exterior areas like Sausalito and Muir Woods, etc. The staff was always attentive, the rooms were always clean and orderly, and a door was always opened for you before reaching the front door. There were other nice amenities like ice buckets filled nightly, as well as extremely quick and efficient service when it came to any room requests that were out of the norm, along with the morning coffee and afternoon tea in the lobby made for a nice comfortable stay. The rooms are nicely decorated with warm colors making it feel more like home. A positive overall experience equating to a definite return the next time I'm in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience!”
Reviews.Author: dtaggart
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott for a conference and would definitely stay again. Room was clean, comfortable (with feather beds and down comforters), and offered a nice view of the city. Internet wasn't free, but you could get the $4.95 option for 24 hours and they provided the Internet hookups-- in other hotels, you either have to provide your own or pay for the the cords. Staff was courteous and friendly. When I needed something printed for an 8 am presentation and the business office wasn't open until 8 am, the concierge allowed me to print from her computer. When I asked for a late checkout, the front desk was extremely friendly and gave me a 2 pm checkout. When there was an overcharge on the hotel bill, I called the front desk and it was changed immediately. Great location, near Union square, BART station (took it from the airport), can take the trolley down to Fisherman's Wharf for 1.50. Everything is really accessible and everyone was very friendly. Food is expensive at the hotel, but Mel's Diner around the corner is great for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fabulous Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: airwis
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews before my stay I made sure that when I checked in I asked for a renovated room. The front desk staff said that all the rooms have been completely renovated. The room I stayed at was the best Marriott property room I ever stayed in. The rooms are big, the beds are wonderful, 52 inch flat screen TV, the color themes in the room are warm and relaxing and the bathroom I must say is a work of art. The brown marble walls and showers are beautiful. The doormen were always there opening the doors as you entered or exited the hotel, asking if transportation was needed, they were just wonderful. The front desk staff could not have been any nicer than what they were, and the staff walking around the hotel were very attentive. My first night there I was walking around the hall with my ice bucket not knowing that all you had to do was call from your room and someone would bring some ice to you, well as I was walking a staff member noticed my ice bucket and asked what room I was in and he would have someone bring me some ice, with in 3 minutes someone was there with ice. How wonderful is that. I guess the lobby and restaurant is going thru renovation and will be completed by end of March but you would never know it. They have the check in area so concealed from any work that you would never know that work was being done. The area around the hotel is safe and so many shops and eating areas plus any type of transportation is a block away (trolley cars). I cant wait to go back....

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: simulcrum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW just before Thanksgiving, a veeeery quiet period for the hotel. The room was not remodeled, and will benefit from an updating, but it was clean, well maintained and very comfortable -- particularly the bed and desk chair (and how unusual is that!) The bathroom is marvelous. Unlike some reviewers, I found the service attentive. I don't use hotel services much, but when I asked for assistance, it was prompt and courteous. Did not use the restaurants; the bar was nice, but pricey -- hey, it's SF. Location is great. I usually stay at the SF Marriott on 4th. This is clearly a grade up in style and attention, but both are terrific properties, with wonderful locations. If a first time visitor or someone still doing mostly touristy stuff, I might actually give the edge to the hotel on 4th because of the very close proximity to the Fl ine! If you've been to SF before, choose this one for a touch more luxury.

Reviews.Title: “So nice...”
Reviews.Author: fonk24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in 2006. Fantastic hotel, beds are really comfortable. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: sgsilva
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel when it was the Pan Pacific Hotel more than a couple dozen of times. I recently stayed there after it became the JW Marriott. I have always loved this hotel. It is a architectural masterpiece. With incredible marble bathrooms, stunning lobby and great rooms this WAS one of the finest hotels in a city full of great hotels. My only problem is with the renovation converting it to a Marriott. Before it was a oasis of class. Now with the changes it has all the charm of a hotel located near a airport. The carpet outside the guest rooms is hideous and loud. Looking down the atrium all you see is this ugly carpet totally distracting from the beautiful design of the building. The only improvement in the rooms is new, larger t.v.s. The new furnishings are bland and basic. Marriott did a excellent job in removing all of the charm and elegance from this hotel. People who have never stayed at this property will most likely love it because it is still a great hotel in a unbeatable location. But for those of us who knew it before the change it is very sad. The interior designer and the executives who approved the new design should be sacked. While I was there the main lobby was closed and being redone. I shudder to think of how Marriott will ruin that formerly beautiful space. So I mourn the loss of a great and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the JW Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: parmihawaii
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days over the Thanksgiving holiday in San Francisco at the JW Marriott. Being an online travel website editor/content writer here in Hawaii, I spend a great deal of time on TripAdvisor checking out people's reviews of Hawaii hotels so did the same for San Francisco. Four of us flew out of Honolulu on a red-eye and arrived at the hotel at about 7:30 am, bleary-eyed and exhausted. I had called the hotel and requested renovated rooms on a higher floor in the back (after having read various reviews of it being noisy with sirens, etc.), but I never asked for early check-in, but I did mentioned we were flying in on a red-eye. I never expected that either room would be available at that time, but our friends room was, so we could freshen up and leave our luggage there with our connecting room ready by 11 am. The rooms are elegant and beautifully decorated with the classic "wish I had it at home" Marriott bed and bedding. Large flat screen TV, many amenities and one of the most beautiful bathrooms I've ever seen in any hotel. We were on the 14th floor and we never heard any sounds of sirens, etc. and the rooms were extremely quiet and immaculate. But even with all this elegance we agreed the best part of the JW Marriott was the staff, from the bellmen to the front desk, concierge, restaurant, bar, housekeeping and valets and every person we met. They smiled, were genuinely friendly and always greeted us, gave some excellent advice on where to eat, made reservations, etc., etc. In Hawaii we speak often of Aloha spirit and it actually is a lovely thing, but we all agreed that we had found real Aloha spirit at the JW Marriott on this trip. Interestingly, many people here told me I would be disappointed in San Francisco as it was dirty, lots of druggies and homeless (I had lived in Palo Alto for 5 years and spent a great deal of time up in the city). I am not sure where these people were, because we all found it super clean, with friendly people, streets very clean and even the homeless we did see were neatly dressed and did not hassle us and we walked everywhere with no problems. Would we go back again - in a millisecond! It's a wonderful hotel with a great staff in an ideal location in one of the most beautiful cities in the world. JW Marriott San Francisco thank you for an unforgettable vacation. And as soon as we can get both airline reservations and hotel we'll be booking again, except for a longer time.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we thought it would be....”
Reviews.Author: PhillyGal123
Reviews.Content: We were really looking forward to our San Francisco vacation and it really was a perfect weekend - except for the hotel. When you think of a 5 star hotel you think service, luxury and proximity. Hmmm....the JW Marriott did not even reach 5 star quality in ANY of these areas. While the rooms were spacious they were completely outdated. It took room service over an hour to get to us and they acted as if I did something wrong. The concierge (Kyle?) was completely off the mark when recommending restaurants. Sounds like it was more based on a kick back than anything else b/c he sent us to some young kids bar at 50 years old!! Checking in was just fine except for the checking out part. You felt as if they couldn't wait to be rid of two people who made absolutely no trouble. I would NEVER stay in a Marriott again - all b/c of this place. Awful, awful, awful....

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaCPA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in SF for the dates of November 4-11, 2007. I was there for my honeymoon. Upon arrival, I was impressed with the staff. The bellhop helped unloaded our bags from the taxi and gave us a claim ticket. Check-in was a breeze. We received an upgrade due to the fact it was our honeymoon. Once in our room, our bags arrived within 10 minutes. As for the room, we were in a newly renovated executive suite with a city view. It was very nice. The room consisted of a large flat screen TV, king size bed, couch, chair, desk, and separate tub and shower. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. One problem I encountered was in the morning when I wanted to take a shower there would be no hot water. I ended up having to take a bath that I was not happy with. I have had the same problem with not having hot water in the morning at other hotels. I got over it. The staff was great at the hotel. We never had to open a door. The bar had great drinks. We enjoyed drinking at the hotel bar better than anywhere else. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown. This was a great location. We did not need a car to get anywhere. I would recommend the JW Marriott to anyone. My husband and I will be returning to SF in 2010 and we definitely will be staying at the JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LGPITT
Reviews.Content: On the final night of our tour of CA, we stayed at the JW in SF. We had asked for a high floor because of other reviews regarding remodeling. As of Nov. 17th - I think only the first 2 floors of rooms were still being remodeled and the manager had told us that the lobby was to begin the following week. The rooms were beautiful and we loved the bathroom. The bathroom had a separate shower and bathtub; the beds were extremely comfortable; flat screen TV; and the room was very spacious. We thought the lobby and bar was nice (2 fireplaces with comfortable chairs around them) -but he had said they were remodeling to make it more contemporary. The staff in this hotel was exceptional delivering anything we needed to our room. The only complaint we had about this hotel was the parking - it was $45 a day. Fortunately for us, we didn't really need our car anymore, so we returned it early instead of paying for the parking. Overall, this was by far the nicest of the 4 Marriott's we stayed at during our trip and was not the most expensive. I would definitely recommend this to anyone going to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: SRCNV
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed numerous times at the Marriott in San Francisco located at 55 fourth street in SF. We always enjoyed our stay there! We were not impressed with the staff at the JW Marriott When we arrived we carried our own luggage inside the building ,While staff members watched .Oh they did open our car door. We placed our bags on a bell mans cart,Then a staff member ran up handed us a claim ticket and shooed us away.We then went up to check in that was pleasant . We then went to our room we wanted to freshen up before our meeting ,The room way nice but had been freshly painted the outside balcony still had a large amount of plastic where they were still painting.We had to wait almost a half hour for our bags to be brought up to the room. The bellman insisted he receive a tip he just stood there ,Of course we tipped him. As a matter of fact ,All the Staff were so pushy for tips even for a bucket of ice (the hotel wouldn't allow us to get it ourselves) We stayed two nights at this Jw Marriott .We tipped to the tune of almost $250.00 to this pushy lazy staff. The bed linens were Not changed and were clearly soiled,The maid also did not vacuum or wipe anything down ,We were happy just to receive clean tiles. My husband works for the Government (The hotel would not honor any discount ) That was okay ,We also own a Rare Coin and Jewelry Company ,It was the principal of the matter. I am also disabled and at the other Marriott at 55 fourth street ,I was not charged for handicap parking .This hotel charged us approx. $88.00 a night. When we arrived back to the hotel the second night of our stay the valet parking attendant rudely stated he thought we had checked out??? What an insult ,I explained to him we were staying two nights . He rudely gave us another claim ticket for our auto. I then went inside to talk to someone at the front desk ,Their was a young dark haired Asian man there, He also was nasty, All I wanted to do was make sure we were Still booked for two nights ? He told me yes ,Then I asked about the parking situation with handicapped parking ? He stated Each Marriott was independently owned and operated and their Hotel Valet was Separately ran and they had nothing to do with Valet (what)...I then had valet bring our auto back we moved it to the corner where their was a handicap parking on the street. upon checking out that next day we carried our own bags down ,I waited for my husband to get the car ,While I waited I could hear the Valet parking attendants laughing goofing off. I wanted to go back in and talk to someone at the check in desk ,But after the Nasty Rude person I spoke to the night before I was frankly a little Scared to. After my husband brought the car round four of the valet parking attendants ran over to open the doors really pushy ,My guess is they wanted More Tips.Hum maybe because they were holding their hands out with their palms up? When we received our bill for a regular room two nights stay ,We were charged two nights valet parking even though we moved the car. The bill came to $880.00 without any room service or anything else. Wow I don't ever want to pay to be treated this way again.I did make a call after we returned back home to Reno Nv. I spoke to someone who was very kind ,However it had been over 24 hours and he could not adjust the bill.. Please everyone Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan Luxury??? Not until the renovations are complete!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sean_in_Arizona
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many a JW… and have always been satisfied with the rooms… but lemme tell you, if you are planning on staying here…DEMAND a renovated room or a huge discount!! I can only blame myself for requesting a very early check-in … the only room available for early check in was on a “low” floor...exhausted I accepted…I was never told the room was not renovated. The room was clean, and typical …but NOT A JW!!! The only reason I didn’t complain is due to the fact the room had the JW bed and beddings, Bose radio and a plasma screen TV … aside from that…. NOTHING in the room was reminiscent of a JW. The carpet was worn, the furniture was dilapidated, the “finish” on the sink and bath tub were actually cracking and peeling! I think I got a mini derma-abrasion from the rough towels provided. I recognized the bath products from a Hilton Garden Inn I stayed in last week… I never found the mini-bar…The in room coffee maker was inadequate.. no name coffee with powdered creamer… How can sister hotel Ritz Carlton have such a fine coffee set up with Brand name coffees & real cream… and JW get play-school props?? Amazing!!! When I tried to use the complementary town car service, I was told by the driver his trunk was full and could not accommodate by belongings… strange as I was his only passenger?! I must give this hotel props though… the location cannot be beat…the staff…although they neglected to alert me that the room was an old Pan Pacific room, were very accommodating and pleasant. The common areas were beautiful as are the renovated rooms …..Should you be lucky enuf to secure one.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4-Star Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mid_West_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in August, 2007 at this hotel. I was very pleased with everything. ROOM: I was assigned one of the renovated rooms and it was beautiful, quiet, comfortable, spacious, and had lots of ammenities like separate shower and tub, electronic laptop safe, large functional desk, and large flat screen TV. The bed was outstanding as were the linens, pillows, and duvet. SERVICE: Service was excellent throughout my stay. There is a button on the wall in your room that you can push for just about any request. Someone appears at your door in a few moments - - service was efficient and fast. Every staff member I encountered was very polite and helpful. FITNESS: The hotel has a very nice fitness center with great equipment. CONCIERGE LOUNGE: The concierge lounge provides an excellent extended continental breakfast. TIP: the lounge gets crowded so I recommend you show up for breakfast early. LOCATION: The location is great - - right off Union Square behind the Westin St. Francis. RENOVATIONS: Although this hotel is going through a total renovation, you hardly notice it. I was impressed with how quiet the workers were. They hardly made any noise and certainly had no effect on my enjoyable stay. They are closing one floor at a time for renovations starting at the top and working down. I think the top 5 or 6 floors are done. The lobby is scheduled for renovation beginning in November. VALUE: This is not the most luxe, beautiful, or celebrated hotel in S.F. but it's an excellent choice and an excellent value when you consider that its rates are 1/2 or less than those at some of the 5-Star luxury hotels nearby. I've stayed at some of these hotels and they are amazing but I think the J.W. Marriott matches most of their quality and services at a much lower cost. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Historiana
Reviews.Content: Must say that we were a bit disappointed with this Marriott property. When we were checking in guests on either side of us were arguing about their reservation. We had made a standard reservation for myself, my wife and our daughter. The room they gave us had a king bed with no room for a roll-away. The only solution was to pay for an upgrade to a small suite. The hotel is centrally located in the business district although the neighborhood did not feel that comfortable in the evening. The reception is on the third floor which is not the most convenient and the parking at $45 per night is steep. The room was a little worn but the hotel is undergoing renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely!”
Reviews.Author: AlaskanTraveller
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy check-in, easy check-out, clean, comfortable, beyond inviting, just-right fitness center, knowledegable staff & the fun is in the details! Would definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: sylvrunr
Reviews.Content: We just got back from San Francisco. My husband attended a conference at the hotel and I joined him with our 18-month old son. The hotel is very nice and should be positively fabulous once the renovation is complete. The service is excellent! The concierge was terrific, providing maps, directions and wonderful dining suggestions. The door was always held open for us when we left and returned. We had a very nice room on the 13th floor with very comfy beds. (Now I know I need a new mattress at home!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlDva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in March for 3 nights, and I really enjoyed my stay. I was upgraded to a spacious corner room, which had a small sitting area, flat screen TV, and Bose radio. Incredibly comfortable bed and nice shower. Service was outstanding, but the best part is the location. About a block from Union Square and tons of shopping! They also have a complimentary car service, which I used one night meeting a friend for dinner. I would highly recommend this hotel, and would probably stay here again. Extras: If you like Greek food, there is a fantastic restaurant called "Kokari's" which has some of the best Greek food I've ever had. Great ambiance, service and food. It's not cheap, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at a great hotel in a great location with comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: heavenlymoon76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the JW Marriott for 4 nights. The hotel is located only a couple of blocks from Union Square and a mere 10 min cab ride to Pier 39. The rooms are a bit small, and a little out dated, but we didn't spend much time in the room so that was ok. The beds are really comfy and cozy. Our room was on the 8th floor (813) and our window was overlooking Post Street. It can be quite noisy from the traffic (especially for us since we are from the desert and never hear traffic ever). The noise usually dies down around 10pm (later on the weekends) and then starts back up again arond 5am. If you aren't used to the noise, you may want to ask for a room on a higher floor or a room that is not located directly on Post Street. I think the one great thing that sets this hotel apart from others is the staff. They are remarkable! Very friendly, very accomodating and very helpful. We only ate breakfast at the restaurant located in the hotel, and it was pretty good. For about $20 you can get the breakfast buffet with fresh fruit, pastries, bagels, cereals, eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes etc. All in all we had a great time and would definetely stay here again (sounds like the hotel is going to be pretty posh after the remodel too).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: racerdog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pan Pacific for 4 days in May of 2005 while attending a Diabetes Technology Conference. The hotel is lovely and the staff were friendly and very helpful. My room was a double queen. It was a lovely room, very clean, posh bathroom, housekeeping was excellent. The local is ideal for exploring the city. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superior hotel. Great service, great location, top notch all around.”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHoustonian
Reviews.Content: Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous. This hotel is a notch above the rest. The service is unbelievable. You need dinner reservations at a restaurant perfectly suited for your mood? No problem. Great theatre seats? Piece of cake. The staff is falling over themselves in an effort to make your stay more pleasant. The rooms are extremely nice. This hotel easily surpasses the average Westin, Intercontinental, etc. I can't recommend this hotel enough. You will love it.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott - Nice but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: jazzmom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 night stay at the JW near Union Square. Originally had been booked into the Parc 55, but found out they are no longer part of Marriott. Not willing to give up 5 nights of points, we changed hotels. Check in was smooth. The entire hotel is undergoing a reno over the next 6-9 months and the new design looks great. Very vibrant and sophisticated. Our assigned room was nice but not yet redone. Good size for a big city hotel. Small flat screen tv was nice. Bathroom was spacious and covered with brown marble, but a bit dated. Apparently part of the decor from the former asian theme hotel chain. Room did not have access to refrigeration which is always so great to have. Also the bedside lighting was poor due to the energy saving fluorescent ring bulbs. Housekeeping was a bit of a weak spot as well. After 4 days, I finally called to ask for my shower stall to be treated for mildew. It was overlooked each day. Used the Concierge Lounge a few times in the morning and in the evening. Very nice breakfast options and sweets for dessert after dinner. Always so nice to have access to. Used the airport shuttle service arranged by hotel concierge for trip to airport. Worked just fine and saved money for sure. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: 4familySanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of our stay was nothing short of perfect. If I could give six stars I would . And if it wasn't perfect to begin with it was fixed immediately. Two of the windows in our gorgeous room (corner overlooking Union Square) didn't close properly and the engineer came up and fixed them right away. We asked for a fridge for the room - again delivered immediately. Extra pillows, no problem. More coffee, no problem. Our room was spotless and well appointed. The bed was comfortable - lighting was good, great work space and the bathrooms are fabulous. In fact, we were surprised to find out the hotel was in the middle of a remodel. Every request was kindly answered from how often the cable cars ran to asking the concierge at 5:30pm on Saturday evening if he knew of a place to get a manicure late and out of thin air he found one around the corner open until 7:30pm. Fantastic! The hotel was at high occupancy and we didn't hear noise from other guests or see any service issues - again - everything perfect. We had an amazing dinner at the restaurant in the lobby. The gentleman that served us went above and beyond to meet every request including helping us negotiate the menu for our son who is allergic to egg. He had the kitchen prepare special chicken nuggets for him. (We have NEVER had any hotel or dining place go to the effort of creativity.) Our son was captivated by the inside elevator and beautiful fountain in the lobby. My husband and my meals rivaled those of our favorite places to eat. We found out later that it's one of the best places to eat in San Francisco. Room service was incredible -- right on time and everything delicious. Our little guy thought the Disney on demand (little Einstein's and Mickey mouse) in the room was terrific and didn't want to go home. In fact, it was heard to tear him from the room watching the traffic and Union Square from the window so we will definitely be back. The hotel is one block from the cable car line down to Fisherman's wharf. It's right off of Union Square and the location is the best place to be in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!! Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: shelleyr25
Reviews.Content: Stayed over on July 4th weekend for one night and was very pleased. Our room was not ready when we arrived at 3pm but were quickly upgraded to a large suite!! Our room had 2 beautiful bathrooms, queen bed, sleeper sofa, kitchen area, office area and so much more. For a family of 4 it beats sharing one room with 2 double beds anytime!! The service at the front desk was fine and my kids loved the bowl of apples that were always out for the taking. Valet parking was great and when we parked our car and needed to grab a cab in a rush we were offered the hotels car service instead for no charge!! Now that is service!! Our package included breakfast for 2 at the buffet in the morning and although it was not a huge spread everything was very tasty and nicely presented. Service was a tad slow but I am also an impatient person :) All in all I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - Would return in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: pinkhorse
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, and was told it used to be the Pan Pacific Hotel which retained some of its asian themes. The bed and feather-pillows were luxurious and very comfortable. Complimentary robes were given and they even had a phone in the bathroom. Caution, don't push the button in the bathroom, unless you want the conceirge to call you! There was a turn-down service, which was nice. The service is impeccable, the staff was friendly & helpful. I liked the location of the hotel, which is very close to all the shopping you need. For cocktails, hit up the Redroom, which has a classy bar-lounge atmosphere. I stayed with a friend, but this hotel could serve nicely as a family or romantic getaway. You can't beat the location. Park at the Union Street Garage which is a short walk away. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Opus367
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with clients. Staff was courteous and accommodating. Beds were extremely comfortable. Bose radio was amazing. Could use some updates and a larger LCD TV but I was told a major renovation will be happening in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: djyankeesny
Reviews.Content: We just completed a week long stay at the JW Marriott San Francisco from 6/18-6/25. Overall, the hotel was nice and very clean. The doormen were extremely nice and helpful with getting directions or a taxicab. The concierge was also very helpful with assisting us in planning our days site seeing events. The hotel is located pretty much around the corner from Union Square and all the shopping a girl could ever ask for! The hotel has a lovely restaurant that, though pricey, is very tastey. Room service is prompt and friendly. So overall a good stay. There were only few things we were unhappy about were, the beds were kind of soft, so I woke up with a backache and a neckache from the equally soft pillows. Also slightly inconvenient was the false fire alarms that went off twice during the night while we were sound asleep. I can't say I would stay here again because I probably wont go back to San Francisco, but I didn't see another hotel in the city that I woud have rather stayed at. Sorry, we didn't take photos of the hotel or room, but the photos on the website are accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Dave/Kim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott San Francisco from June 15-17, 2007 and were very impressed! After reading the trip advisor reviews, I was sorry that Priceline had accepted our bid ($89) and very nervous as we had 3 rooms booked for a graduation. After we parked at the parking lot across the street (thanks reviewers), we were greeted at the front desk without a wait and given rooms on the 38th floor (the View lounge is on the 39th). The reviewers who stated that priceline customers were treated with little respect were wrong on our account. The view from our room was awesome of the Bay Bridge and beyond. The room was very clean (I'm very picky) and well decorated, the gym fantastic, Starbucks in the lobby very convenient and the "View Lounge" beautiful with great service and view of the entire city. The location is fantastic (close to Union Square shopping)! The coffee service in the room was broken and a new one was brought up within 5 minutes on a busy Saturday morning. We will return to this wonderful property and hope that Marriott accepts our Priceline bid in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother.”
Reviews.Author: xoxx
Reviews.Content: Don't expect the quality of the usual JW Marriott brand. This hotel is starting to undergo renovations and until completed, is currently like any worn-out Marriott. Decor is dated, rooms are unattractive- old, worn funiture, minibars have been removed. Basically, it's a tired hotel with no luxuries. Staff are pleasant, but not particularly attentive for a 4 star property. Location is close to Union Square. You can do better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveTraveler77
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was nice, but really not a WOW factor like many says. Valet Parking was expensive; I used a parking lot around the corner for far less. We didn't eat much at the hotel but for the two times we did we used room service, and ate a nice Asian restaurant located in the lobby at the rear of the hotel; food was good both times. Though a few streets away from major crime area, like anywhere where you find clubs, hotel is near Union Square and shopping. Visitors center located near the hotel go purchase Cable Car tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Akgambler
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a nice location. I would say though, that it is barely "above" average, only because there is nothing really special about it. The rooms are nice, and the bathrooms roomy. My husband doesn't care for the pedestal sink and feels there was a shortage of counter space - but I found the shelves useful instead. Like all hotels, not enough outlets in the bathroom. Nice mirror, nice seperate tub and shower, and a tv. Comfortable bed and linens. What I didn't like was the lounge area. Very cold, not fun to sit and have a cocktail and visit there. The location of this hotel is excellent. Probably for SF the price is reasonable, but given the choice I might stay at the Donatello next time (right next door) for the decor and price. Like staying at Marriotts in general to get my rewards points, but a little pricey for the ammenities provided.
