The room itself was very large (it was a Deluxe King) and the bathroom was really nice. The tub with seperate shower was a plus as my wife could take a relaxing bath while I showered. It seems that the trend in hotels is to provide very large rooms. I don't understand why someone needs such a large room, particularly when they are very sparcely decorated, as was this room. It just made the room feel a bit cold and empty. There was a nice LCD TV, but again, when placed in a room that was so large, it looked really small. Believe it or not, I think a smaller room would've felt much more comfortable and luxurious. The problems began as we got ready for bed. Just as we were about to turn off the lights, my wife noticed a stain on the duvet cover. Upon closer inspection, there several stains (coffee, make-up, etc) and it became obvious that the duvet cover was just plain DIRTY. I called reception and the person who answered said he would send up a replacement. There was no apology and I could not detect the slightest feeling of concern from the person who answered the phone. Housekeeping arrived about 15 minutes later. Unfortunately, the person at reception did not tell housekeeping that it was the duvet cover that needed replacing, not the sheets. Housekeeping (who was very friendly and helpful) brought up new sheets. He looked at the duvet cover and said that they did not have extras. So we asked if he could bring us some extra blankets, which he did. While the blankets themselves were a bit ratty (one had a cigarette burn), they kept us warm. The bed was adequate, but it was NOT the Sealy they boast about in the book they have in the room that boasts about the high level of attention they pay to each guests individual needs. Rather, the mattress was a basic flat mattress with an old featherbed placed on top. We had asked for an 8am wake-up call but didn't need it. At 7:15am, we were awakened by the sound of construction work going on at the adjacent property. We could not go back to sleep. So much for sleeping in. Upon check-out, the person at reception asked how our stay was. When I told her that aside from the dirty duvet cover and being awakened by the construction, it was OK. She gave a nervous laugh and said "Wow, that sounds adventurous. I'm sorry." I guess she did say sorry, but it was obvious she didn't want to ask any questions and did not want to know any more about it. So much for close attention to their guests individual needs. If this is what you get with a 4-star property and for $269 per night, they can have it. I'll go back to small bed and breakfasts where the owners take a personal interest in making sure each guest's needs are attended to and that each guest is completely happy with every aspect of their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Left my heart at Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: JSB5150
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Francisco three days ago. After horrible delays with the airline we finally arrived at the Pan Pacific 11 hours late. The hotel was a very pleasant suprise after the dissapointment with the airline. The staff was extremely caring and helpful to us. The room was OUTSTANDING and the private butler service was a nice touch. The bed was just right and the huge bathroom luxurious. My wife took a long hot bath and so everyone was happy. The next day we spoke with Jason at the concierge desk and he was top notch- very knowledgeable and totally professional. I would stay there again for sure. Our maid was happy and pleasant and told us she would come back whenever we wanted since we needed to sleep a little late the first morning. Also, the location is very good for downtown walking and dining, etc. It's a $9.00 cab to Fisherman's Wharf and 22 blocks on foot back there if the cablecars breakdown (they did) and taxi's are all full (they were). You will be spolied at this hotel, but the extra $$$ you pay per night will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific is a great hotel in an ideal location to walk around San Francisco and for public transport. The room was spacious and it was great to be able to order room service and rent a movie. Also we asked the concierge for tickets to a giants game on a Saturday and she got them for us soo quickly. All in all a great stay and would go back the next time I was in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “non-view hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Asked for a room (luxury king) with a view upon check-in and was given a room on the 16th floor looking out to a wall. Called the front desk and was told the hotel is a nonview hotel and the room had good views compared to other rooms. Subsquently found out there are rooms available with a view. I told the general manager that I felt the front desk was not up-front with me regarding rooms with a view. I felt they should have just stated none were available if that was the case. The manager stated he would speak to the front desk however he did not ask my name or room number so very doubtful that he followed through. For about the same money the Westin, Hyatt, Marriott and the Fairmont have views and in my opinion have better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over the July 4th weekend of 2005. We were in a luxury king room which we liked very much. It was spacious and we loved the marble appointed bathroom with stall shower and a tub. The service was very good. They have a nice gym. They are just one block west of Union Square and walking distance to Chinatown. As we were leaving the day after the 4th we heard construction noise from across the street, which we had not heard until then because the workers were off for the weekend and holiday - so I recommend you wait until the construction is complete if you plan on being there during the week. We will definitely stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had the same problem with construction the user below had on July 4th weekend - however, we simply asked to be moved and the hotel promptly had a bellman up to our room to move our bags to the other room. Packing was annoying, but we were leaving in 2 days so it didnt matter much. The rooms were immaculate, bathrooms were clean and gorgeous, and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. Got room service for the night of July 4th, lasagna and a cheese quesadilla and was very tasty. Beds are amazing, and aside from the construction next door (prior to the room change), the rooms were ultra quiet. Would def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but construction ruined it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In terms of value and quality this was one of the best hotels I've stayed in. The staff is very friendly and the room was clean with a decent amount of space. The bathtub is also a good size for a hotel room so lying in it is very comfortable. My complaint is the construction going on next door. I know this is in no way the Pan Pacific's fault but that doesn't mean it doesn't effect the quality of your stay. I stayed there during the 4th of July weekend and had no problems on Saturday, Sunday or Monday morning since those weren't work days. However, on Tuesday I was woken up at 7am by the sounds of drilling and hammering coming from the building next door. I could not get back to sleep and I'm sure many other guests had the same problem. Who likes to get up at 7am during a vacation or business trip? I would recommend this hotel once the construction is over but while its still going on, I would not want to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a great trip to San Francisco. The Pan Pacific was a great choice for the price. The accomodations were very clean and comfortable and the staff was always very helpful. When we return to SF, we will definitely return to the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have used trip advisor for several trips now and I have not been disappointed. I have found that you are the best source to find a hotel. My family and I were traveling to Yosemite and decided to stay three days in San Francisco. It was a hard decision to make but after reading your reviews decided on the Pan Pacific in San Francisco. What a wonderful decision. The hotel' s location is great -- it is within walking distance of many many stores/shopping. It is a short distance (5 minute walk) to the cable cars, Chinatown (walking distance a little longer), if you are renting from Hertz I believe they will do that for you (at least I know they will return the car for a $5 fee), and many other restaurants for breakfast, lunch and dinner. They are also close to several drug stores and mini markets. The hotel is beautiful inside and the rooms were roomy for 2 adults and 2 children with 5 pieces of luggage. The service and concierge were exceptional and went out of their way to do extra things for us. I cannot say enough about this place and the people who are working there. After going to Yosemite and several others places we needed to return to San Francisco for our return flight home and wanted to stayed again at the Pan Pacific which we did. The concierge printed our boarding passes for our airline and even arranged for a cab to be downstairs at a certain time to take us to the airport. This hotel even offers free car service during certain times of the day and several times instead of a cab they offered us the car for our own use. We loved this hotel and its location and would definitely stay here again. Finally, although a little more in price I was able to go on the Pan Pacific web site and get an internet special for several nights. Even if you pay a little more for this hotel -- you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Room -Not!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When seeing our room, that was standard, we decided to upgrade. Given choice of Deluxe or Luxury, we choose Luxury. Well, it was larger, but the bathroom was not as well equiped as the standard, no TV and smaller. Definately not worth the extra $50 per night. It took 30 minutes just to get a bucket of ice both evenings we were there. The room and beds were very comfortable, but for the price and service, I would try another hotel next time visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,Great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just spent a weekend at the Pan Pacific. Our room rate averaged $100. per night for a three day stay! The hotel was five star in all respects. I have stayed in many ultra luxury five star hotels, but have never experienced a better hotel for the money. The hotel has been recently rennovated and the rooms were clean and well appointed with a flat screen television and a second tv in the bathroom. The concierge and staff were great. We even got to use their complimentary limo a couple of times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Terrific deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights. The hotel is in a top location off Union Square. If you like an active lobby with ornate furniture this is not for you. But if you like contemporary style, plush bathrooms, and attentive--but not stuffy--service, you'll like this. Everyone was friendly and helpful--door men, concierge, check-in, etc. Also, if you book by June 30 with Amex, you pay 1/2 price and the third night is free--essentially 3 nights for the price of one (rack rate).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet class”
Reviews.Author: sabbaticalPlanner
Reviews.Content: Wonderful clean decor done with impeccable taste. Quiet rooms, no one bothers you, but everyone is available at a moments notice to help you. A complimentary hotel car is available to take guest to restaurants, plays, etc. Parking which is usually $42 a night was included in a recent special rate. Nice add-on.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kevinc
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in, until checkout, the 4 days at the Pan Pacific was the highlight of a 10 day California vacation! Everyone was very helpful and efficient with always a friendly greeting, the best cocierge desk. Our large room was immaculate and very comfortable. The huge bathroom was fantastic, television and phone included!! We were very sad to leave. The location was the best! You will not be dissapointed in the Pan Pacific. Out of curiousity, as we were walking around the city, we checked out some other hotel properties that we were considering from Trip Advisor. Just from the greeting we received, or lack of, they did not even compare to the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for an AWESOME Price !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? The Pan Pacific is one of the BEST hotels I've stayed at in San Francisco. Booked through Expedia for (I think) $140 a night for a Superior Room. Got at the hotel at about 2pm, and they checked me in early, which is great. Check-in was extremely quick. I also took an upgrade to a Pacific Suite for only $300 for my 4-night stay. I LOVED the suite I was upgraded to. Now about the suite: Opened the door and heard lovely jazz music. Walked in and saw the living room. Very nice TVs and Bose Clock Radios. Also a very nice first bathroom. I then opened up the sliding french doors to the bedroom. Great beds, not too soft and not too hard. Just right! Great desk with egronomic chair. The view was great but I could see some buildings. I woke up one morning to a guy staring straight into my room from across the street. He was pretty far away, so it's okay. Very nice master bathroom with a small but good television in it. Very nice overall! Now about the service: Service was very prompt. Didn't order any room service so I cannot comment on that. Conceriege was great. Asked for recommedations on good steakhouses and recommended the Morton's right down the street. Housekeeping was great too, as well as turndown service. Great doormen, all greeted me by name by the third night. Opened the door for me every time I stepped up to the hotel even if they were talking to someone else. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION: Those three words came to mind when I first came to the hotel. One block from Union Square, 6 blocks from Moscone Center (where my conference was being held), and restaurants right when you step out the door. 10% off Macy's Coupon when you check-in which is great. Starbuck's is only a block away which is EXCELLENT since I practically went there like every two hours. Walgreen's was about two blocks away, which is also EXCELLENT for getting soda, snacks, and other stuff. RESTAURANT: Went to the hotel's restaurant for three mornings in a row for their breakfast buffet. No omelet bar, but hey who needs that? Pretty good for the price. OVERALL: I really recommend this hotel to anyone coming to San Francisco. Great location and prices through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rather than stay at the recommended chain hotel for the large conference I was attending, I chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews & they were right on the mark, once again. I requested & received a quiet room on a high floor - I could see the hills & the Bay in the distance. The room was tasteful, comfortable & clean, and the bed was outstanding. Firm, with a soft topper & soft pillows & a doublesheeted light down comforter. Just perfect. Terry robes, morning paper, pleasant and accommodating staff. Late one evening I had some trouble regulating the AC & I called the front desk. Within 5 minutes, the engineer was there to fix it. It was a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: vickam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific. My only advice to any readers of this site is : Stay there! I found this to be an excellent hotel in every respect. Beautiful accommodation and location could not be more convenient. On my next visit to S.F. I will stay there and if this hotel is not available I will change my travelling dates. Excellent - this hotel was a highlight of the holiday

Reviews.Title: “Nearly excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrankiestOne
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the Pan, with a two-night break in the middle of our stay. After the first three nights, we agreed that the hotel was just missing the mark....it was almost excellent. We never felt "welcomed" when we checked in; the gentleman at the front desk simply wasn't friendly. The rooms are average size, but didn't feel cramped. The bathrooms are small, but ours had a separate tub/shower which was a nice touch. The bathrooms are beautifully appointed. The butler service is a nice touch. The hotel definitely does not want its guests doing for themselves--if you want ice, contact your butler to bring it, because it's not available at the end of the hall! There is a courtesy car service, which was one of the selling points for us. However, it is not available on Sunday, not available between 9:30a-5:30p, and doesn't go beyond a two-mile radius. Fisherman's Wharf was too far. In fact, we weren't able to use the "courtesy" car until we went to the airport, for which we paid a $45 fee. On our return for the last two nights, we had a more enjoyable check-in. We learned that the valet would return our rental car for a $5 fee (could be worth if if you don't want to deal with traffic). In the end, this is a very Japanese hotel--the staff was obedient; they reacted to our needs but didn't well anticipate them.

Reviews.Title: “Slept like a Baby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 nights on Hotwire for $108 a night. I could not have afforded it otherwise. This is a four or five star hotel. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a junior suite at no extra charge. The bed had a pillow top and was marvelous. I slept like a baby. Our room had a flat screen tv and also a tv in the bathroom. The bathroom had a tub and a glass shower. The concierge was great, very knowledgeable and recommended some great restaurants as well as made our dinner reservations. The hotel is located in Union Square. So, it is walking distance to the trolley cars and shopping. I would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: planeman
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend at the Pan Pacific...The hotel's location is fantastic!!.. with walking distance to Union Square. The Hotel is very elegant. The rooms are large and trendy..the bed was wonderful. The bathroom was small with very little counter space, but it is all marble and very chic. The room came with robes a nice touch. The service was also very prompt and professional from everyone. You can park across the street at a parking garage for $28.00 instead of the $45.00 the hotel charges for valet parking. All in all I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I read all of the reviews in the Trip Advisor prior to my trip and had some concerns. My daughter and I stayed at the Pan Pacific Easter week, 2005. This hotel was incredible. The room, although not spacious, was clean, modern and the bathroom is incredible. The staff? EXTREMELY courteous, polite and helpful with EVERYTHING. The car available to guests is a great perk. I will definitely stay nowhere else but the Pan Pacific when visiting San Francisco again! Really!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Anndale
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Pan Pacific Hotel and we loved it. The location is within walking distance of the cable car lines, Union Square, the Bart and Chinatown. The staff was wonderful, knowledgeable and very helpful.. The doorman even went out of his way to get us a nicer taxi,when we tried to use the towncar service and a towncar was not available. The rooms are wonderful, especially the beds which was almost more comfortable than home... We would highly recommend this Hotel, and will gladly stay again if we return to San Francisco...

Reviews.Title: “Great location for San Francisco exploration”
Reviews.Author: ksquare
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous week in San Francisco. The Pan Pacific San Francisco is a terrific hotel in a great location. The hotel serves as a great base for exploration of the city. You see, San Francisco is a compact city that is best explored on foot. From the Union Square location of the Pan Pacific hotel, you can easily walk to Chinatown, North Beach, and even Fishermans Wharf. When you visit, make sure to ask the concierge for restaurant recommendations. Although it's easy to find many great restaurants in San Francisco, the Pan Pacific concierge offers a variety of restaurants that tourists wouldn't ordinarily find. Example: Jardiniere near the Civic Center. The concierge arranged for an anniversary dinner for my wife and I. This was one of the most enjoyable dinner experiences ever. Jardiniere is not a tourist restaurant with a view of the city. Instead they offer a fantastic meal served by people who pay attention to every detail. One additional word of advice for those visiting San Francisco: Bring your walking shoes! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: circuitboitravel
Reviews.Content: I tend to stay at alot of hotels in SF, and I had always seen this hotel, and 1 day, decided to try it. The staff knocks you out......Very Friendly, wanting to make sure that you enjoyed your stay, and if there is anything they forgot. Rooms are nice, and a flat screen tv. I think what they have done with the TV's in the bathroom is a terrific idea. How nice to lay in a tub after a hard day and enjoy the tv. The resturant for lunch was nice. It's not a bad walk to the financial district, it took me 10 minutes and I sort of shopped on the way down.

Reviews.Title: “Another great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel I've ever stayed at. Once for my honeymoon last May 2004 and again this time in March 2005 on business. The rooms are spacious and minimalist. The beds are out of this world. The bathrooms are huge and include both a shower stall and bathtub with a TV in there to boot. Amazing service and a breathtaking view in the courtyard. The only downfall is the parking which is $47 a night. Then again, I got the room for $90 on Hotwire, so I can't complain. Overall, this is a perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: NapaValleyGirl
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at this hotel after reading the reviews of it on Trip Advisor. I was never so disapointed in my life. For the price of this hotel I expected alot. I didn't get it. This hotel is not attractive in the least. The rooms were cold and sterile, all white, plain. The 2 beds in the room were tiny, not even doubles. They were each like a slightly bigger twin. The only nice thing was the bathroom. But how much time do you spend in there? The worst part of the trip was the bellhop pounding on our door at 1am, he said he was there to check us out and take our bags? I guess someone wanted to check out in the middle of the night, it wasn't us. The bellhop was confused so we called down to the front desk. They could care less, they didn't know what was going and frankly didn't seem to care. No apology, nothing. Also, parkiing was $42 per night plus 14% TAX. If you want a 5 star hotel experience in San Francisco go to the FAIRMONT, they know how to treat their guests right.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: RumRunner01
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beat. It's right in the middle of it all and you can walk everywhere. However, I was unimpressed with the service. I was here with a group from work for the Builder Show last June, but the staff did not seem very hospitable. The only person who cracked a smile was one of the doormen. Other than that, don't expect much hospitality or warmth. The rooms were very spartan but the bathrooms were magnificent. I loved having the tv in the bathroom. Plus you had a separate tub and shower, though the shower was pretty small. The amenities were really nice too. But other than that the room was very basic and dull. Did not eat at the restaurant as it was very expensive. For a great meal walk down to Maxwells for a great meal at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. My husband and I were from the San Francisco area and recently moved to Hawaii. We were back for the holidays and stayed here right before Christmas and we loved it! The staff were so pleasant and greeted us each night when we came in. We felt like they went above and beyond to be pleasant. The location is close to all, near Union Square and close to good restaurants. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel one block from Union Square”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Wife, Daughter and I stayed for 3 nights at the Pan Pacific in November and would rate this hotel very highly after staying at the Fairmont Orchid Hawaii and the Bellagio. The location is perfect for the shops (we found the Pier 39 area to be tacky) and the rooms are fantastic - spacious, with lcd tv, large windows and a huge bathroom with tv! We didnt eat in the hotel so cant comment on that but the staff were very friendly even though we were clearly one of the poorer guests! As I used tripadvisor to book all our hotels I thought I should share this with you - basically the tripadvisor reviews got it right in all of the hotels we stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “"Great stay - huge room - bathroom exemplary"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for three nights and the room was huge, clean, and had all the amenities for a family of four. The bathroom was perfect with a separate shower and tub and the water pressure was great. The staff was very accommodating and pleasant to work with for directions and assistance. We would highly recommend this hotel to any family travelling to San Francisco. We have stayed at other smaller boutique type hotels and this by far will be where we come back to when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of the Pan Pacific was excellent; however the hotel itself was very mediocre. The hotel is pretty dated. The rooms are nice, but I've seen much better for the price (we did get a screamin'deal on Hotwire of $127.00 per night, which made it adequate for the price) but I would not stay there again for the AAA book prices. The hotel has no panache at all, it is a very sanitary, lifeless hotel. The staff is courteous, when you can find them. The bar/lounge is a joke, and it is so quiet in there you feel like you are at a funeral viewing. When my wife and I do go back to the Union Square area, which we definitely will, we will stay at either the St. Francis, Hyatt, or other which we have had much better stays. Added tip, do NOT eat at Asia de Cuba, which is the restaurant in the Clift Hotel. The food was extremely overpriced, $100+ per person for very small portion and no drinks, and the service was the worst service I have ever had at a restaurant. The food really was not all that good either, I would give the food 1 star out of 5--Panda Express has better asian food.

HotelInfo.Name: JW Marriott San Francisco Union Square
HotelInfo.Address: 500 Post Street, San Francisco, CA 94102 (Formerly Pan Pacific Hotel)
